We really wanted to Snorkel, but with the ocean blowing up we needed am alternative. XEL HA!!!
We were picked up in a monster tour bus, and took the 1hr drive from cancun to Xel Ha. The park is enormous, very busy, but VERY capable to handle the crowds with quality and quantity of service. Mutiple delicious restaurants, bars, tons of gift shops and Snorkel stations. Meticulously maintained grounds. 
The lagoon is huge, and you basically grab your gear, jump in, and go wherever you want. Tons to see, clear warm water, very calm. Lots of awesome fish and animals everywhere.

There were tons of exta$ of course. Photo packs and extra excursions. We booked the SEA TREK. Underwater walking. Very neat but not reccomend for claustrophobic people. 

Our guide was right....we liked it better than our dumpy resort Oasis Sens.

We visited this place in the second week of 2018. We liked it and the weather was great. Below are some pros and cons, hope this helps.

Pros:
 * Great place for snorkeling: nice clear water, you can see different kinds of fish and also stingrays
 * The park itself is amazing; take a moment to admire everything around you: you may encounter iguanas, large parrots and other great animals. There's also a 40m tower that you can climb and see the view from above. And on the way down you can slide, no need to use the stairs!
 * They are providing snorkeling equipment
 * They are providing food
 * All around the park there is a network of cameras you can use and get yourself in some cool pictures

Cons:
 * I would recommend you bring your own snorkeling gear because they are providing a low quality one and it may leak or not work like you expect it to work
 * The food is not good at all... I did not expect that at all but that is what it is
 * If you are planning on taking the phone with you, get yourself an impermeable case beforehand. Because they are selling those at a price 5 times higher than you would normally find them on Amazon for example
 * It is expensive to buy the photos from the park; the ones you took with their cameras

Travelled Dec 18th - 25th, and stayed at Hotel XCaret. Included within our pkg was access to Xecontes. We went on Dec 20th and had a lot of fun. We visited 4 different locations.

First special mention to our guide Carlos. Super energetic, fun, informative, and spoke good English. #GorillaTeam

Recommend bringing water shoes... not 100% necessary but its just easier to walk around. Lunch if provided but don't expect a gourmet lunch. You're eating in the middle of a jungle.. LOL 

Water is pretty cold but you're body gets used to it after you start swimming around. You always have a life jacket on so no worries about swimming. 

Overall I had a fun time and would recommend this trip. We purchased the photo pkg. $60 USD for all the digital copies. They also accept credit cards

I pre booked this tour with my travel agent before I left and didn't really know what to expect.  Went by myself and had a blast! I loved that we got to see 4 different Xenotes and do something different at each one. 
The lunch and snacks provided were great. Our guide was very entertaining and educated.

The only draw back was that the photographer told us we could order our photos and if we didn't have the cash with us they could come to the resort later to collect the money (it was a bit pricey and I wasn't carrying that much cash out of safety.) Later in the trip she then told us this option would not be possible so I could only buy them then. I'm a little bummed I missed out on the photos.

Seeing some sort of cenotes was in the plan for our trip, but we weren't sure which tour to go on.  We are so glad we went on this one.  First of all, Miquel Fischer was our tour guide and showed up on time and we had a few short stops to pick others up and then we were our way!  All of the Cenotes were amazing and each had adventures waiting for us.  I loved jumping off all the cliffs, which was on my bucket list to do.  I would say you need to love adventure and have courage to do some of those jumps.  Miquel was always there to give info about the local plants and animals and also giving encouragement when that was needed.  He also explained what we were in for and what to expect.  I love the pictures of what the Photographer took, but have not received my pictures yet.  So I am a little disappointed, but I hope they return my email and send pictures.  Definitely would recommend this tour!!

Overall:  Hippie Recommended. 

We had a little hiccup in that the booking agent didn‚Äôt tell us about a weight limit on the rappel (I‚Äôm fat) but other than that it was great. 

Before you go:

1- Buy water shoes. You need something on your feet and flip flops WILL fall off.  

2- There is a weight limit on the rappel. 

3- The snorkel is not a snorkel, it‚Äôs a swim. 

4- They supply everything you need. Towels, life jackets, water, lunch, etc...

5- You can leave your stuff in the van. The whole day is spent on properties opened by the xcaret company with xcaret employees and other tourists. Even still, they lock the van. 

6- You only need money if you plan to buy the photos or one of their things (t-shirts, water shoes, towels, etc...). 

Pickup:

We booked through our hotel in the Hotel Zone they picked us up in their van. They told us 9:00 but showed up around 9:20. It turns out that they tell everybody the same time and then send a van from hotel to hotel so, depending on where your hotel is they could come earlier or later. 

The Tour:

After they pick you up, you drive their shop & pick up a photographer. Then they will assign your van to go to the four cenotes them in a different order based on the number of people and vans they have that day. Here‚Äôs what we did:

1- Rappel. It‚Äôs not a rappel (you control your speed on a dangling rope), it‚Äôs a controlled descent on a fixed diagonal line. They control your speed as you drop down into the Cenote. The Cenote is mostly underground with two openings in the roof. 

There is a platform with a ledge for jumping off of and, other than that, you just swim around. If they don‚Äôt let you rappel, you enter via a tunnel & stairs they‚Äôve carved down and in from the side. You exit via that tunnel. 

2- Kayak/Snorkel:

Two in one. The Kayaks are tandem boats that sit up on the water. They‚Äôre easy to paddle and it‚Äôs a short trip. It‚Äôs kind of like renting a paddle boat at an amusement park. Not hard, mostly a photo op. 

The snorkel isn‚Äôt a snorkel. They give you a mask and you swim around. It‚Äôs not that exciting. 

3- Zip Line(s): This was my favorite part of the tour. 

There are two zip lines. One is a bar you hold and the other is a loop you can stand, sit, or hang on/in. You start from a cliff that is about 20 feet high. They‚Äôll also let you jump off the cliff you want. 

Guys or girl wearing a 2 piece suit need to be careful if you‚Äôre going to to ‚ÄúTarzan‚Äù on the loop line. When you hit the water it will flip you around and can cause a hilarious wardrobe malfunction. 

We had lunch after # 3. More on that later. 

4- Fire Cenote (mini-zip, waterslide, swim, cliff jump):

The water slide is a short slide with a 3 foot drop into the water. They let us do it a few times before we did the zip line. After the water slide, you do the mini-zip line and drop off for the swim. The swim is about 300 yards/250 meters. You‚Äôre wearing a life jacket so you just kind of dog paddle; it‚Äôs not hard. 

The cliff jump is another photo op. It‚Äôs about 15 feet, they‚Äôll let multiple people jump at the same time. The photographer is standing by. 

Lunch: 

Lunch is sandwiches with some salads. They have beer, wine, sodas, and water. It‚Äôs not a big spread but it was good. 

While at lunch they‚Äôll show you the photos they‚Äôve taken so far and talk to you about buying them. 

Photos:

When you‚Äôre at the last Cenote they‚Äôll sell you your photos. The price is based on the number in your group.

My mom and I booked this tour when we arrived and I am so glad we stumbled upon it!! Our guide and our photographer were absolutely amazing!! Friendly, funny, fantastic! Freddie was our photographer and the photos were spectacular- he noticed I was very interested in nature so he even included some nature photos.  He was paying attention to each party on our trip and able to take perfect photos (both spontaneous and posed). So impressed and grateful!  I think our guide was Carlos, but I don't remember! He was great and helped make the trip! 

The cenotes were beautiful and the activities were fun.  It was my favorite part of our week in Cancun (by far!)  I would HIGHLY recommend this!! 

My mom is terrified of heights, but with the encouragement of our guide and the group, she did the repelling and the zip line!! She was so glad she went so far out of her comfort zone.  The kayaking was perfect.  

The whole trip was incredible!! No complaints!

Great day. Noah was our awesome guide. I was concerned that we needed to be super fit but it was a great day, even for myself a senior.  I also have fear of heights and hurt my shoulder recently, there was no pressure to go beyond my limit and there was a real commradry among our group.  Our tour was limited to our van, 16 or 18 people, even though there were 4 vans, we never felt crowded. There are life guards everywhere and the workers are very safety conscious.  Guide will hold your eyeglasses if needed. Recommend underwater camera and water shoes. They will give you 2 towels, don't use 1 until very end. Flushed toilets and very decent facilities.You will be wet most of the day and cool since we are under the cover of trees. You can leave your things in van for safekeeping, bring dry clothes to change into. Noah never asked for a tip at anytime, but definitely deserved them.

The best tour in Yucat√°n we've taken so far.

Una excursion muy divertida por 4 xenotes. Una hermosa naturaleza !!! El picnic y los snaks superaron nuestra expectativa. Compramos las fotos y las enviaron de inmediato via mail. Maravillosa experiencia

Xenotes Oasis Maya

Really Fun! 
I knew we made the right decision to go on this tour when the group that was going on the van with us, from our resort, said it is their second time going on this trip. This tour caught my attention for two reasons: 1) My daughter had never been to a  cenote, and this trip offered several different kinds, and 2) It got really good reviews from T.A.  I generally try to stay away from gimmicky tours that offer ziplining, rappelling, etc (been there, done that) but I have to admit, it was really fun doing all these things!!! The first cenote had a water slide, the other cenotes had really fun zip lines, a small cliff jump, that was scary for me, none the less, and we got rappelled into another cenote. It was especially fun doing it as a group because everyone was encouraging others, who were too scared to do some of the activities. And some people went crazy with the zip lines or jumping off the cliff doing all sorts of acrobatic stuff. The group laughed, guffawed, "ooo-ed and ahh-ed" at all the antics. What also made it great was that we could do everything numerous times! Saul our tour guide and his assistant Annaia....(?) were lovely. And, each cenote was truly Beautiful! FYI, I've been to several different cenotes in the past and the only drawback to this tour is the following: if you are interested in really going underground to explore a cave cenote and do more snorkeling, I would recommend you try something different like Rio Secreto or others.

We had an amazing day with our guide, Yosua, visiting 4 different incredible cenotes. The snacks and lunch we got were delicious. The cenotes were absolutely stunning, and there were super fun activities at each one - kayaking, zip lining, rapeling, etc. At our last cenote, the strap on my camera broke and my camera sunk to the bottom of the cenote. Our guide Yosua volunteered to free dive 8 meters and retrieve my camera for me. All in all an incredible day! Highly recommended to families, couples, etc. :)

We booked this tour as part of a two package combo with Xplor, and I must say that Xcaret knows how to do the adventure parks right! Our guide, Noel ‚Äúel gordo‚Äù was fun, kept the group interested, and challenged us throughout the day. He was very focused to make sure we enjoyed the entire day, and shared his knowledge of the history of the Cenotes and the ecosystems we were visiting. 

This was much more than the swimming that is only offered at most of the cenotes. This tour took us to four different ones so that we could see the closed Cenote, semi open and open ones. Most of the cenotes involved zip lining and cliff jumping which added to the adrenaline of the day. 

A must do your if you enjoy adventure in the jungle.

Amazing views!!! Our guide Eduardo was knowledgeable. There were cenotes (caves) all over and we got to snorkel, swim, kayak and zip line in caves. The views were so beautiful. You even get to see bats in one of the cenotes. Perfect for people who enjoy water and adventures at the same time. It's a whole day trip and the ticket price includes transportation, towels and lunch. So, plan accordingly. One thing that I am super impressed was with how neat and tidy the facilities are (very well maintained). Probably the best facilities I've ever been to esp in an adventurous place like these.

This place is very beautiful, but that's about as far as it goes.  We were staying at a resort and took a day trip here.  Our day started off eating the horrible breakfast buffet.  That set the tone for the rest of the day.  Lunch was even worse at the Mexican restaurant.  None of the food was even recognizable and it was horrible.  We eventually found a restaurant that served American-type food, but it still left a lot to be desired. They have no bottled water or any place inside the park to purchase a bottled drink.  After seeing the quality of the food, there was no way I was going to drink anything there unless it came in a bottle.  Luckily we brought bottled water with us but it didn't last us all day.  We had to choose between staying hydrated or risk getting sick.  Unfortunately, my wife and I both still ended up getting sick from the food.  We haven't felt right for a few days after eating at this place.  This was the only place we ate at outside our resort.  

All of the interesting activities at this park cost extra money.  The park is extremely overcrowded, and the snorkeling gear is awful.  The masks fog up in less than a minute.  There were a few cool fish that we saw, but mostly the snorkeling was nothing great.  Everything is so far spread out, and the maps are definitely not to scale and it takes a long time just to figure out where you're going or where you are.  There is a river you can float down that is seriously about a mile long.  And there is no current to take you down the river, so you're left trying to paddle with your arms for a mile while sitting in your tube.  Not a very fun experience.  The one thing we did enjoy was riding the bikes, but it's a very short ride and the bikes are all in bad condition.  There are some nice shaded areas to sit at by the water, but we could have done that at our all-inclusive resort with food and drinks that we were not afraid to consume.  We got a great view and picture at the top of the tower water slide, which was cool, but it's hardly worth the price of admission.

Overall, this place was a complete waste of time and ended up being the opposite of why we went on vacation--to relax.  There are kids everywhere and so many people that it is impossible to enjoy yourself.  We arrived around 9am and by 2pm we were ready to leave.  The downside was our bus wasn't coming back until 6pm, so we literally counted down the minutes just to get out of the park.  I would not recommend eating the food or staying all day.  We might have had a better experience if we only went for half a day and ate at our resort before and after, but all things considered, we had a terrible experience.

I'm not sure I can add to what others have said to expect when you go there.  I'm glad I pre-read the reviews and both my husband and i brought our own water shoes (you can find them on Amazon for about $10/pair).  I highly recommend this, as those who wore flip-flops had to carry them around.  Based on a recommendation, I also wore a water shirt, and I was glad i did, as a few of the caves were a bit chilly.   We also brought our own snorkel equipment, but I'm not sure that was necessary.  

Our photographer, Elias, captured some incredible images, and we decided to purchase the $58US package. Our guide (also Elias), was very knowledgable about the cenotes and very patient with me continuously chickening out to jump off the cliff(s).  I finally gained the courage and went for it.  

I will add that my husband and I both recently lost some weight, which was very helpful for the excursion. It took some effort to climb and do some of the swimming.  There is no way we could have done this excursion a year ago and fully appreciate all it had to offer had we not have lost the weight.  While I think they will be accommodating for all fitness levels, it does require a certain amount of effort.  

I'm so glad we went on this excursion and will probably try it again.

We were so fortunate to have Amet as our guide!  Although the tour is worth EVERY penny, he made a great day extraordinary.  It was clearly evident that his goal was two-fold; first, to ensure our safety and well being, and second, to ensure we had an experience that we will remember for a lifetime!  

Amet was certain that before we participated in the activities available at each of the 4 sites, we understood the history and importance of the cenotes to the Mayans.  His knowledge of history, wild life and vegetation was vast, and he took time to answer any and all questions.

The activities were so much fun, and although safety is their number one priority, there was never a doubt that the ultimate goal of our guide and the staff was making certain everyone in our group was smiling the entire time.  Our group of 18 started as strangers but all became friends before the day was done.  Thanks Amet!  Coyotes rule!!

This excursion was hands down one of the best experiences I have ever had on a vacation. The cenotes were beautiful and fun. Everyone was very nice and knowledgeable. Our guide Elias was very nice and friendly. It didn‚Äôt even matter that it was colder at the time for Mexico because it was so beautiful. Also, after getting out of each xenote there was always a table set up with snacks and coffee and hot chocolate, and we were given towels to warm up in.

When I first heard about this place, I thought just another water park. Boy, was I wrong! Xcaret is huge and beautiful. There was so much for you to do in one day. Snorkeling was great. Water was clear lot of activities underwater. Many shaded places to just relax. So many verities of food to choose from. I would come back again if i'm in the area.

We had a great time. Serveano was an amazing tour guide. So fun all the time. Xenotes were beautiful, activities fun, and lunch was good. The one activity is supposed to be rappelling but it‚Äôs more like a controlled decent. And there was no snorkeling, just goggles to look at the bottom of one centoe.
Would never go again. Worst of all parks, every activity is extra. Snorkeling water is not clear, staff less than professional, food nothing special.

Our family of 4 (parents with 2 adult children) had a great time.  We visited 4 different xenotes and our guide, abuelo, was fantastic.  He made everyone feel comfortable and was very professional at all times.  Our group had a young girl that wasn't a strong swimmer and he swam along side her (we wore life jackets when we were in the water at all times).  2 towels are provided but I recommend bringing one of your own also as you are in the water 4 different times.  The lunch was delicious and water/wine/beer/pop are provided at some of the stops.
La mejor experiencia de mi vida, excelente atenci√≥n por parte del gu√≠a Luis y del fot√≥grafo Luis, la comida muy rica, el personal ( salvavidas, anfitriones etc) muy atentos y muy cordiales

Lugares hermosos para visitar en los que se tiene contacto con la bella naturaleza en todos los sentidos, desde momentos en los que √©sta se puede contemplar en calma, hasta aquellos llenos de aventura. Los l√≠deres del grupo son tan h√°biles en su labor, que llegan hacer sentir al grupo como una familia a pesar de estar compuesta de personas completamente desconocidas y de diferentes nacionalidades; adem√°s de que muestran amor y respeto por la naturaleza. Me queda √∫nicamente agradecer por la hermosa a experiencia y por el incre√≠ble y divertid√≠simo liderazgo de Severiano, y junto al amor de fot√≥grafos Carlos y Alberto. ¬°Saludos!

We went with me and my husband, my 6yr old daughter and 9yr old son.  Also had my 74 yr old mother in law.   Truly a great day.   We did not see any other young children but I would recommend it if your kids love the water and are super comfortable in it.   Lots of stairs so that was a bit rough for my mother in law but she handled all the water adventures like a champ.   No safety issues.   Great food.  They provide everything and b prepared to buy the photos.   They r better than anything you can take and you don‚Äôt risk losing your camera in a 100 foot deep cenote.

Highly recommended for young and old! Even though, we felt rushed by our guide - particularly the first two cenotes; and felt that we didn't have enough time to enjoy the beauty surrounding us. Ziplining, kayaking, rappelling, swimming, water sliding, jumping off cliffs - a really fun day in paradise. You can do as much or as little as you like. Recommend bringing your own snorkel; also, watershoes, flip-flops, rash guard, additional swimwear, and a change of clothes. Just keep in mind that there is barely any storage space in the van; you'll have to keep your belongings on your lap. Van gets locked when you do the activities, so think hard -and fast (if you get Gorilla's Carlos for a guide) -  about the things you want to take with you, before you take off into the jungle.

Me and my children had a great experience at xenotes, our tour guide(can‚Äôt remember his name) and photographer (Gina) were amazing. Great lunch and coffee break. Delicious water of Jamaica and hot chocolate. 
Loved the views and the adventure!
Es impresionante! Gracias Rub√©n (gu√≠a del tour) por todo el entusiasmo

Amet was our guide for the day visiting 4 cenotes.  We had an awesome time rappelling and jumping into a cenote, snorkeling in a cenote/cave, kayaking in a river, zip lining into a cenote, and sliding/swimming/cliff jumping into a cenote/river. The water was fresh, beautiful and warm. The scenery was gorgeous - we were in the jungle with no bugs!!!!!  What an awesome array of things we got to do!  Lunch was plentiful. Mandatory life vests were helpful. We got to lock up valuables in the van during excursions.  I bought a wet shirt because it was a rainy morning and that came in helpful.  They also sold water shoes (recommend highly) and eyeglass straps in the van. Great trip. I took my underwater camera in the snorkeling/kayaking stop and then should have taken it for the swim/jump stop but got it from the van and took a few pictures afterwards. The snorkeling portion is just a mask and no tube but the space is small, so not a big deal but I took my own stuff for that stop. Glad there was a pro photographer there so I bought the pics!  Do this tour!  It‚Äôs great!

This was my adult daughter and myself. 
This would fall into one of our favorite excursions anywhere. 
We were allowed time to swim and jump off of rocks and cliffs in addition to the scheduled activities. 
There were plenty of guides and support staff. Our group was limited to about 10-12 people so you got personal attention when appropriate and helpful instructions when needed. 
Lunch was included- a nice deli selection. Drinks were supplied often. 
I would do this again in a heartbeat! 
This was GREAT!

My wife and I spent two weeks in the Mayan Riviera just before Christmas 2017. We did 7 different excursions from our resort and this was our favourite one! This adventure tour takes you to 4 different cenotes, and each one is different than the last. You get to zipline into the water (at two of them), cliff jump (if you want to), rappel (controlled descent), snorkel, kayak, and do lots of swimming (with a life jacket) and enjoying the beautiful scenic (and natural) locations. They say swimming in a cenote is one of the top things to do in the Mayan Riviera, and I have to agree. This tour is a great way to experience just a few of the thousands of cenotes in the area. I highly recommend. Our tour guide, Helios, was the best! He was very informative and a lot of fun to spend the day with.

I love this activity! It has so many things to offer. The guides are fun, the camera person does a fantastic job. It's fun to drive through the jungle and see little villages and kids out playing or walking to school. I felt safe with the activities, driving, and in the areas where we went. I love the water so if you are not a water person this may not be good for you but if you love the water you'll love this!

You can have snorkeling, kayak, swimming, cliff jump, rappel, and zip lines in one day. Our guide, Sa√∫l was great, and the photographer, √Ålvaro took amazing pictures.

My boyfriend and I took the Xenotes tour on our 2nd last day of our 2 week Mexican Vacation. If I was going to do 1 thing while in Mexico, visiting a cenote was on the top of my list! 

Miguel Fisher was our tour guide and a lot of fun. He was super knowledgeable about the local plants, vegetation, animals and made the tour exciting. 

The views we had were out of this world and truly unique. We did purchase the picture package after the tour and had a few issues in downloading our pictures, but we did eventually get our pictures. 

If I was going to say one thing about the tour it would be that it is quite "adventurous". I personally found that the brochure we got when booking the tour didn't properly advertise this. There was a lot of steep rock climbing, cliff jumping, zip lining (holding only onto a handlebar), rappelling, kayaking, swimming & snorkeling. There was a small child on our trip and she didn't participate in a lot of the activities. So just be aware that this is more than just swimming in cenotes. 

Price for value was well worth it and I HIGHLY recommend enjoying this tour.

Having read through a mix of reviews, I can understand their views. It was part of the price of our hotel so never paid for the experience. If I had paid the full amount, I would be putting in a poorer review (note the food comment below)

Not for anyone in wheel chairs and doesn‚Äôt drink alcohol.

Hop onto a boat of around 20ppl, sitting around a long table.
You get ice, tequila, soft drink juices, 7-up, Corona, etc to drink as much as you like. (They top it up during the journey)

The boat sets off with a host to get you in the party mood. Fun intros, some games, etc. You pass other boats with bands within them to give you the chance to clap and dance.
You get served a tray of food, but as we never got this until around 2100hrs, I was starving so eat it anyway - wish I just ate at the hotel. I like my food, but it did look as if they were all sitting out for some time before we got them. Most sauces has ‚Äòskinned‚Äô over & lukewarm. I would certainly question the hygiene standards here. Both myself and wife had runny tummy‚Äôs the day after....

The boat stops for a chance to go to the toilet and then it‚Äôs back on the boat for candy‚Äôs, more drink and dancing finishing around midnight.

At the end, your put on the spotlight to hand over a substantial tip in front of the whole boat. After drinking so much, this could get out of hand.

In all, a good party atmosphere as long as everyone on the boat is up for dancing, but I would certainly question eating anything & handing out a huge tip once full of tequila.

The Park is huge.  For us it was like finding one surprise after the other.  The underground rivers are a must to enjoy.  From the trails, to the Mexican Spectacular show at park closing, we had a great, relaxing (tiring for walking so much) and wonderful day there.  Make sure to arrive by park opening because if you arrive late, you won't have time to experience the whole park.  There are a lot of "hidden" treasures you surely don't want to miss.

Having the park marked with trails makes it easier to move around and enjoy every area to the max.
No se pierdan lo maravilloso de este parque y el fabuloso espect√°culo de cierre mostrando la tradici√≥n y costumbres mexicanas

Me gust√≥ todo! Lo mejor fue el "Xcaret espectacular"!!!  El mapa era un poco confuso pero fuera de eso todo excelente. El buffet de comida internacional era excelente, y la atenci√≥n de los modos muy buena. Eduardo muy atento. Saludos!

The Xcaret theme park was amazing! There were a lot of activities from the very sedate (spa and massages) to extreme (water sports). This allowed all members of our family with varying interests to fully enjoy the day. My biggest delight was the river - oh my goodness!!! Buckling up with life vests (so yes safety was considered) and moving along the river I was able to go through caves, see bats overhead. In addition there were parts of the river which were in the open and at these points I was able to enjoy the sounds and sights of birds, see the sky through trees and just simply be at one with the nature. The highlight of this river experience was swimming and looking up at one part to see stained glass overhead as though in a church. I absolutely loved this experience and would certainly hope to revisit!!!!
Recommend this! Tidy, organized, beautiful things to see and do. The underground river was fabulous and we loved the butterfly house.
We loved it. We probably only covered half the area. Liked our "plus" section for the lockers. Kids loved the turtles.

Elegimos este parque que es excelente, en atenci√≥n y seguridad. Son muy organizados, llegas te dan patas de rana y salvavidas y al agua pato ! Experiencia incre√≠ble vas flotando por un canal y con tu pulsera escaneas  y te sacas las fotos en los mejores lugares. Hicimos actividades con costo extras, snorkel en el oc√©ano , nos llevaron en un yate a un lugar espec√≠fico y vimos peces , tortugas hermosas. Luego mi familia realiz√≥ la atraccion de la caminata submarina, dicen que s√∫per recomendable!! Y para finalizar un show de dos horas que realmente vale la pena verlo ( es sobre la historia de Mexico, pero muy bien puesto en escena, hay danzas, cantantes etc imperdible !

I went with friends and was not expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised! 
Well laid out, easily accessible ( sore foot- scooter day) snorkelling- and the evening show was really exciting and professional.
Worth the Money ($100+) and the Cenote river on site was really fun. Do it in the morning or it gets busy! 

So make the effort and it is so large you will be left wanting to go back and see the rest!!

We are not an amusement park family and hate crowds. After reading so many positive reviews we thought we'd give this place a try. We didn't anticipate lasting the full 12 hours. We arrived at opening and stayed until closing! We went on a Saturday when it is more quiet and there are more locals. This place lived up to all the hype. I was so impressed with how they presented their country and displayed the beauty of their animals and nature. Our kids were so delighted to run around swiping their wrists bands and taking pictures of themselves. The $100 extra for 5 people for the photo package ended up being worth every penny. We ate at the Mexican buffet. The food was good, but a bit expensive for Mexico. It was still worth it because we didn't want to leave the park to find food elsewhere. The evening shows were outstanding. Our kids sat with rapt attention to the Mayan fire dance show, horse show and later evening Mexican History show. We got pictures with some of the actors in full costume. There are no vendors pestering you trying to sell stuff. Most everything is included. The river float was awesome! Our family highly recommends this as a day trip during your visit to Mexico!

Linda experiencia, el d√≠a no alcanza para conocerlo. La comida en los restaurantes buen√≠sima variada. La organizaci√≥n del lugar para entrega de equipos muy buena.  El ese c√°lculo final de calidad. super recomiendo no lo deben perder.

Apesar de perder o telem√≥vel com todas as fotos do dia, isso n√£o impediu que se tratasse de um dia inesquec√≠vel.
Desde as actividades subaqu√°ticas, a zona das aves, das borboletas, a experi√™ncia com golfinhos (pena n√£o nos enviarem as fotos), a subida √† torre e o espect√°culo final, que √© maravilhoso, tudo valeu a pena.

Existen varias maneras de llegar; en taxi, alquilando un coche y tomas la carretera que lleva a Playa del Carmen (Xcaret est√° a 5 Km de este lugar); pero la que escog√≠ fue comprar el boleto en la terminal de autobuses de ADO, en Canc√∫n (Distancia Canc√∫n - Xcaret: 75 Kms). Ah√≠ hay una persona que te ofrece el paquete del d√≠a por US $99.00, este te incluye el autob√∫s, las entradas al parque, visita a las atracciones y la alimentaci√≥n (almuerzo buffet con muy variada propuesta gastron√≥mica) ."Xcaret" significa en maya peque√±a caleta.

En el parque puedes encontrar las siguientes atracciones: voladores de papantla (un grupo de 5 hombre ataviados de atuendos t√≠picos suben a un poste muy alto y se dejan caer girando y amarrados de los tobillos; mientras uno de ellos toca una flauta sentado en la punta del poste), la representaci√≥n del pueblo maya (Te muestran la vida de los mayas y sus ceremonias), el cementerio (una representaci√≥n de un cementerio mexicano), puedes ver tortugas en un estanque, visitar el acuario, practicar esn√≥rquel, explorar cuevas, nadar en una caleta o en el r√≠o subterr√°neo; entre muchas otras cosas.

El parque est√° muy bien pensado en distribuci√≥n y cuenta con preciosas estructuras arquitect√≥nicas.
A las 5:00 p.m. no puedes perderte el maravilloso espect√°culo en el anfiteatro, te reciben personajes con vestimenta maya: Es una representaci√≥n de danzas t√≠picas mejicanas, iniciando con un ancestral juego de la pelota, que resulta muy interesante ver como colocan la pelota en un peque√±o aro de piedra, golpe√°ndola con la cadera. Puedes pagar la cena y disfrutarla mientras ves el espect√°culo (La cena (este costo es extra).

Recomiendo totalmente este lugar para visitar con toda la familia.

El aurob√∫s regrasar√° por t√≠ a las 8:00 p.m. y en una hora y media estar√°s de regreso en Canc√∫n.

Si est√°n en la bella ciudad de Canc√∫n (En el estado de Quintana Roo, Mexico), no puedees dejar pasar la oportunidad de visitar este lindo lugar.
La primera vez que fuimos no nos quedamos a ver el espect√°culo que ofrece como cierre del paseo en el parque, lo hicimos el a√±o pasado y nos pareci√≥ una rese√±a de la cultura mexicana!
So much to do and see here that you really need two days and an evening to get it all in! We really enjoyed the aquariums, the Mayan Village, the birds, and the cemetery was stunning!
There are many fun attractions here that combine nature with a theme park.  The food at the park was ok.  Make sure you bring your swim suit.  This is an interactive park.

maravillosa experiencia,con variedad de actividades tanto acuaticas como terrestres,y con un imperdible espectaculo folclorico sobre la tarde noche que emociona gratamente,tiene una gran oferta gastronomica,y innumerables lugares de descanso y relax,muy recomendable

Had a great time here with my girlfriend during our vacation to Mexico! The aviary is fantastic to see all the birds & the butterfly pavillion is great too. There are a ton of water activities like underground rivers and a beachfront area too. There was even an aquarium!

We loved Xcarat. It was like Disneyland with sharks. Beautifully maintained and so much to see. We did the shark encounter and the swim with dolphins. Both were great and really interesting but if we go again, we won't book so much extra stuff. There is a lot to see and lots of places to swim just for the entrance fee, and we ran out of time.

Este Eco parque es maravilloso, no alcanza un d√≠a para ver todo lo que tiene, tiene variedad de actividades, espect√°culos durante el d√≠a, y el show de la noche "M√©xico Espectacular" es eso mismo. Cuidan mucho la ecolog√≠a, es muy limpio (le√≠ en alg√∫n lugar que tienen una certificaci√≥n de higiene).
Mis recomendaciones son: 
- Llegar a primera hora, para poder disfrutarlo.
1. Pagar el paquete Xcaret Plus que incluye la comida "all you can eat" incluida, aunque hab√≠a le√≠do que no conven√≠a tanto, pues si conviene, tiene mucha variedad de platos, diferentes restaurantes, algunos mas especializados, bebidas sin alcohol incluidas y una cerveza, la atenci√≥n excelente y la comida muy sabrosa. Este paquete incluye locker y snorckel gratuito.
2. Antes de ir, especialmente si van por un d√≠a, descarguen un mapa y definan las rutas que tomaran y las actividades que har√°n (puesto que hay algunas que no valen la pena y har√≠an perder el tiempo), el parque tiene 6 rutas de colores que facilitan la visita de sus atracciones.
3. Al llegar revisen los horarios de los shows y programenlo en sus rutas para no perderse nada, lo voladores de Papantla y el show ecuestre valen la pena.
4. Traten de hacer el ri√≥ subterr√°neo antes de medio d√≠a, porque luego se llena.
5. Las actividades acu√°ticas tienen un costo aparte.
6. Desde playa del Carmen es r√°pido (15 min) y econ√≥mico llegar en taxi, y de salida afuera hay lineas de taxi.
7. Llevar zapato deportivo o sandalias comodas, se camina mucho, agua y snacks, y llevar una mochila para guardar sus cambios y una toalla (se puede dejar en el locker todo el d√≠a).
8. Si les queda fuerza, pasear un poco de noche, todo lo ponen iluminado y se ve tan diferente.

La atenci√≥n de toooodo el personal de todos lados es super amable y amigable, siempre dispuestos a colaborar, desde que uno llega hasta que se va ve sonrisas.
Este parque es un imperdible.

We went here in November and had a great time.  Finding people that speak English was not an issue and there are lockers to put personal items for the day.  The swim through the tunnels is the highlight for the kids (8, 10, 12), but it can be a bit crowded in the tunnels.  It is pretty dark in there so we just linked arms with the 8 year old to keep nerves down.  It was a cool experience.  Nice thing is you can get out at a couple locations if you get cold or want to move on.

The kid section was pretty cool.  The girls went through the obstacle course a couple of times.  They really liked this section.

The buffet lunch was good and plenty of choices for the girls.  We went to LA PEN√çNSULA RESTAURANT and service was good as well as selection.  

We did stay for the late show which was very well done.  My wife and daughters liked it more than I did, but it was worth seeing.  Definitely worth the cultural education.  Getting out was a mad house as the crowd coming out was pretty large so keep the little ones close.

All in all it was a great visit.  It was a long day with a lot of walking for the kids, but they still talk about going there.  There is so much to see you can easily fill a day.

He de decir que esta es la segunda vez que visito este parque, la primera hace 14 a√±os y ahora en Enero de 2018, y me llev√© una grata sorpresa, impresionantemente organizado desde que entras se nota la log√≠stica y el control que tienen sobre los m√°s de 7,000 visitantes que estuvieron el d√≠a de mi visita, fui con toda mi familia (somos 7), mi hijo mayor tiene 19 y la menor 6 a√±os, por lo que hay para entretener a todas las edades desde las 9:30 am hasta las 9:30 pm.   Contratar el paquete de fotograf√≠a vale mucho la pena, as√≠ como recomiendo ampliamente contratar el paquete Plus que incluye la zona Plus (Lockers -bastante √∫til-, ba√±os y vestidores), el equipo de snorquel y la comida bufet.   Llegar y pasar ala zona Plus para dejar en el locker lo que no has de cargar es importante, no recomiendo cargar celular si lo que deseas es disfrutar del recorrido sobretodo del r√≠o subterr√°neo, ah√≠ es donde el paquete de fotograf√≠a cobra importancia porque por todo el recorrido hay c√°maras estrat√©gicamente posicionadas que te dar√°n una perspectiva incre√≠ble a tus momentos que no alcanzar√°s con un celular o con alguna c√°mara a prueba de agua.   A tomar en cuenta es realizar el recorrido acu√°tico y la playa antes de tomar el bufet y aqu√≠ hay varias opciones, la comida mexicana, la caribe√±a, el bufet de mariscos, la comida mediterr√°nea y la internacional.  En esta ocasi√≥n decidimos por el bufet de mariscos, de lo cual nos arrepentimos tengo que decir que la barra fr√≠a estaba genial con gran selecci√≥n de aguachiles y cocteles, no as√≠ la barra caliente que era realmente mala falta de sabores y una muy pobre selecci√≥n de platillos.    Recorran cada uno de los caminos se√±alados en varios colores y darse el tiempo en cada uno de ellos para tomarse fotograf√≠as por lo que deber√°n ser cuidadosos en los tiempos para poder recorrerlo todo y alcanzar a pasar a recoger sus cosas y cambiarse de ropa antes del show nocturno que comienza a las 7 pm y el cual es IMPERDIBLE, sin lugar a dudas uno de los mejores shows que he visto, un viaje incre√≠ble por la historia mexicana desde los or√≠genes de nuestras culturas ancestrales hasta nuestros d√≠as pasando por la conquista, el virreinato, la independencia, la revoluci√≥n, en fin es m√°gico de principio a fin.   Mis hijos a pesar del cansancio acumulado disfrutaron todo el recorrido de principio a fin.   Para algunas personas podr√° resultar caro, poco m√°s de 2,000 pesos por persona en promedio, pero vale mucho la pena.   No se lo pierdan!!

Para quem nunca foi, √© uma √≥tima op√ß√£o parque com passeios nos rios subterr√¢neos, um bonito aquisitivo e outras atividades que s√£o pagas a parte. Como tudo em Canc√∫n, pre√ßos excessivos, tanto das atra√ß√µes, como dos consumos. O show no final √© muito bem feito, uma atividade obrigat√≥ria

Un super parque natural en medio de la Riviera Maya donde se pasa todo el dia sin darse cuenta y sin agotarse. Muy bien organizado y con un personal super atento y calificado, orgullosos de su naturaleza y su historia. Muy buenos los restaurantes, en particular el de la comida yucateca recomendable si se comienza el recorrido pasadas las 11a.m. y comenzar exactamente almorzando para luego hacer las excursiones. It is a combination of zoo and leisure park. You can watch animals, go to shows or you can also do some activities like swimming in the long river or just swim in the sea. There is also a beach and sunbeds inside. So we first were just walking around and watching, taking photos, then we were using the beach and then we did the river experience. It was tiring and adventurous, but finally, we enjoyed it. Most of the activities and shows are free of charge, only a few special activities are charged extra (we didn't do any of this. Photos are charged with 60 US, but you can do as many photos you want in the package. All photos are watermarked.
Excellent. We used our Master Card and got the second day free (no free food though). Swam in river channels and rode the tower car.

Es una forma de presentar una gran cultura como la Mexicana y atracciones, es muy significativo y hermoso a Nosotros se nos enchina la piel de lo bello y realmente es un orgullo estos detalles FELICIDADES!!

This is not a one-day place, nor is it cheap.  You have to pay for access to this "theme park," which is very big.  You would think that is a good thing, but we spent a lot of time walking back and forth from our locker location and the activities we wanted to do.  It is in the middle of a very jungle-like area, so there are lots of mosquitoes.  They only allow you to use natural products, which did not keep me from being bitten.  I don't know why, but those bites lasted several weeks and they only went away after being put on an over the counter anti-histamine and a corticosteroid.

There are some cool aspects to this place, the underground rivers are nice, but needed to be lit in lots of places.  It isn't safe swimming around in a dark cave with no staff near by in case of emergencies.

The tours for all the expensive stuff are scheduled so close to each other that, even if you could afford it, you would have to pick and choose.

The food was ok.

Cada peso que uno invierte en Xcaret lo vale. Una excelente infraestructura, diferentes actividades, una belleza en los paisajes, buena atenci√≥n por parte del personal, buena calidad en alimentos. Muy buen parque tem√°tico, muchas alternativas, el recorrido acu√°tico es hermoso...el espectaculo de cierre alucinante, recorre gran parte de la historia de MEXICO...

My wife and I plus our 3 kids (20,18 + 14) visited the park.
The transport from our hotel was part of the package.  And was very proffesional and efficient.
We were the only non spanish speaking people on the bus but the guide spent extra time with us making sure we understood everything prior to heading off.
The River swim was excellent and very well rtun with regards to getting all the gear required.  The only thing that may be done better would tp explain the river had a couple of options on which way to go.
Getting around the park is very easy due to the use of coloured paths thru each section.
We really like the photo spots set up all around the park where you scan your entry arm band to take the photo. Great idea guys.
The animal enclosures and variety of animals was excellent. In truth im not a fan of Zoos but this place was excellent.
We also had the food package and its well worth it as the food in the Buffet was excellent quality and quantity.
To top of a great day we watch the show and I must say it was absolutely fantastic. 
It was great to get to learn about the history of Mexico. It would have been even better if we could have had an english version to help us understand. (Something like headphones playing the lyrics in enghlish maybe)
Overall i would highly recommend going to Xcaret. If interacting with animals is on your to do this look into doing it all at this place as i suspect you will save some money

Cheers

En el parque se puede pasar el d√≠a completo, hay muchas opciones para cada edad y gusto. Hay actividades acu√°ticas, playa, actividades culturales, espect√°culos, preciosos animales. El √∫nico inconveniente de parque en si es, que sacando de lado que la entrada al parque es bastante cara, muchas de las actividades mas interesantes son pagas, y son en dolares, hablamos de unos 50/60 dolares mas por cada actividad por cada persona, y para las personas de am√©rica latina se resulta muy costoso porque el dolar nos resulta muy caro.

We have been to this park many times when kids were young. After over ten years, my husband still missing the night show at that big theater so we went again around 4PM. You pay less money when enter the park at 4PM. During day time you have time to explore many area of the park, including swimming in underground river, snorkeling, swimming with stingrays and many shows. If you enter by 4PM you just have time to go through their eco site and take a boat ride, watch the Mayans pray for their God ( you can either walk through open area or go through the underground passage which is cool), also watch horse show. The night time show is at big theater which can probably hold about 2000 people. The show starts at 7PM which you have time to get to the tower next to it to have a view of whole site.  Mexican love their country or I should say the way they interact with those performers is eye opening.

Beautiful park, wonderful way to spend a long day.  One day is not enough to see everything so decide ahead of time what you want to do.  We went to the aviary, butterfly pavilion, underground river swim (definitely don't miss!), River boat ride, snorkeling, and saw lots of the shows. There  were lots of activities for additional cost like swim with dolphins or sting rays, speed boat ride, parasailing, but we did not do any of them.  There is something for everyone here!

Xoximilco was a really good time, though I imagine the time you have is totally based on who you go with and how much fun you actually want to have.  If you aren't looking forward to it and focus on the cons, you might be miserable, but if you go to try and enjoy it, you can have a blast.

The pros are the alcohol flows freely and our captain (Alvin) and driver (Avi) went above and beyond trying to make sure everyone had a blast.  The food was mostly good and everyone on the boat was there to have a good time so the atmosphere was pretty fantastic.  When we went the weather was pretty great too, though I could see that as being something that could be an issue depending on when you go.

The cons are what made me give it a four instead of a five.  So each boat is made to seat 20, and we had 24, which means we were squished in almost uncomfortably close and we had a shortage of cups and places to put them (there are indented spots in the table for cups to keep them from falling as the boat goes).  The food, although good, was a bit sparse particularly when everyone is drinking a lot, and while they had chips and salsa it was impossible for some people to reach salsas and there were no plates or anything to serve on so you would miss out depending on where you sat.  So in all it was a bit uncomfortable in some ways, but it was still a blast regardless.

Another item of note that some drinkers may want to prepare for is that the experience is 3-4 hours long, and we only stopped once to use the bathroom about halfway through.  So if you're there drinking all the included beer, you may be into some trouble.

This is a must to experience a Mexican Vibe with traditional food and music.  And did I mention that it‚Äôs an on going party!!!  Great staff and awesome atmosphere.  The entire spectacle takes place on a calm river boat ride with stops to experience the folk music and food

Buena experiencia y agradable trato nos divertimos y armamos bonito ambiente entre los hermanos Latinoamericanos: Peru, Colombia, Costa Rica y Paisanos de Monterrey y por supuesto del Estado de Hidalgo M√©xico de Epazoyucan Hgo. Sus amigos y servidores, solo menciono que cada qui√©n es responsable de sus acciones y nosotros nos gusto y no ingerimos ninguna bebida alcoh√≥lica pero mis respetos a todos los dem√°s hasta pronto un saludo a Mario y Diego muy bien ambos anfitriones de la trajinera

We went to Xoximilco the night before we left.. we wish it was the first night, so we can go every day... hahaha 5 adults and 1 toddler (4 yr old) GREAT FOOD, great taste of Mexico, the people, music, Mexican Culture is something to be proud about guys!!! Great job!!! We will be coming back soon, thank you for everything.. üòç

It was my second time visiting bringing a good friend to the experience.  He was not dissapointed at all.  You get to experience the music and the food of the mexican culture.  Since it also depends on the group on your "trajinera", this time around was not as joyful as my first time but still we had a great time.

My only "but...": make sure to ask the host to keep a "family oriented" tone on the comments, jokes, etc.  Ours this time was a little sexist and made most of us uncomfortable with the jokes and some games.  He disregarded that we had kids among us.  Also, at the end he basically forced us to put tips into their piggy bank (to be split equally between the host and the "driver").  Thankfully the boat "driver" was so nice that it contrasted the host's jokes.

But, don't get me wrong.  Still we had a great time but my first time around almost two years ago... we had a blast!!!!

My wife and I booked Xoximilco at our nearby hotel Secrets Silversands as it looked like a different experience and a fun way to spend an evening. We were not disappointed. We were picked up from the resort with a short transfer to the venue. Our host for the night was Sigmundo or Silver for short. On arrival there are drinks and snacks (churros and a corn dish), with music and dancing. Make use of the toilets as there aren't any until halfway round the waterways. Use the insect repellent cream. You are assigned to boat with about 20 people per boat. You are pushed around the waterways like on a large gondola, docking with other boats that dish up food or have live bands playing music from different regions of Mexico. Our host Sigmundo was superb, he really worked hard to make sure everyone had a great time and joined in the fun with dancing and drinking games. The food was ok but definitely not the reason you would choose this experience. The fun came from the music and the interaction with the host and other partygoers. Food and drink is all inclusive with soft drinks, beer, vodka, bacardi and of course Tequila.

Highly recommended, mostly for adults although there was a little Mexican girl on our boat who had a great time.

Very bad experience with a Server this past weekend when I ask the name they told me he's name was Baltazar Garcia!! I will never waist my money on this place again or even recommend this horrible service

We had the most amazing magical day, starting with the underground river. It was cool, peaceful, misty, beautiful  and just the adventure of a lifetime! That alone would have been worth the money. I didnt want it to end! But, besides that, we saw Mayan ruins, went snorkeling in the gorgeous little inlet, saw the butterflies (and I do recomme d walking up and around the top part of the exhibit where most of the butterflies are), birds in an amazing aviary with waterfalls & incredible features and species, orchids of the Yucatan peninsula, manta rays, sea turtles, monkeys, and much much more. What a beautiful,  incredible park, clean and meticulously kept! The buffet lunch was huge and amazing. We absolutely loved our day! TIPS: The park is huge, 120 acres. WEAR GOOD SHOES! Also I wanted my own camera on the river. I'm so glad I took it with me instead of leaving it in the locker. I ended up taking 100's of pictures. I had to be very careful not to drop it in the river, but FOR ME, it was worth it to carry it. I love my photos, and didn't want to pay the steep prices for their photo pkgs. Every where we went in this park was incredibly gorgeous. Incredible place!

We visited Xcaret park on January 13, 2018 and I have to say I was not really impressed considering the price we paid per person.
We booked online for the Xcaret Plus package ( $185 a person CAD), we found the information given to be very misleading - we were to get one free buffet lunch and unlimited non-alcoholic drinks and 1 free beer, we got our lunch, were told the beer was not included and then when we tried to get another drink they said that drinks were only included during our 1 visit to the buffet lunch. 
They did not advertise on their site that people with certain health issues should not go in the river - which caused an issue for our group
The pictures and information about the various sites were misleading -
1. Close encounters with Pumas and Jaguars - they are on little tiny island surrounded by a large Valley all the way around and there was 1 of each. 
2.The monkeys were no where to be found.
3. It makes it seem like the animals are not held in small areas like a normal zoo which was not the case - the manatees were in very tiny little areas with barely enough room to move about. Same as the Nurse sharks and dolphins. 
4. The SeaTrek area was basically a little pond
5. We did end up working it out and going in the river (basically taking our chances) the river is nice but nothing special
6. On the site it said our choices for leaving times were 5pm & 7pm when we arrived they were 4:45 & 9:45 - and you had to be out in line a half hour early, so we found that 4;45 didn't give us enough time but 9:45 was too late since it was a 2 hr trip back to our hotel and we were on the bus to go in the morning at 7:05am

We did really enjoy the buffet lunch we got and there was a nice snorkelling area, also the turtles had a pretty nice area. There was a few pretty sites and nice things to see however as far as I am concerned this was definitely not work the price we paid.

Loved the underground river, don't miss that! There are 3 different ones but we didn't realize that in time to do all 3, we only got to do 2. Parasailing, adrenaline, and the dolphins were very fun! It's disappointing that absolutely no cameras are allowed while you're with the dolphins, forcing you to purchase their extremely over priced photo packages if you want any pictures. Speaking of pictures, we bought their park photo packages. You wear wristbands and scan them at different points of the park so you can have your photo taken but don't have to worry about your camera all day. Great idea and it's really cool but I wouldn't recommend purchasing. They make it sound like there are a lot of photo points but there weren't in my opinion, we ended up going back to our locker to get our own camera so we could take more of the photos we wanted. Also, you pay a lot for these photos and then when you download them they have a huge, colorful logo on most of the pictures! Would not have purchased had we known that.  I would definitely return to the park if I had the opportunity, there's a lot to do!

I was with a group of friends in Cancun, one of the activities was Xoximilco, the experience was incredibly fun, from the moment you get to the place until you see the trajineras (boats) everything has a lot of color.
Once they called out Chiapas, our boat name, we boarded and were greeted by the host, then the fun started, docking with other boats that dish up food or have live bands playing music from Mexico. Our host  was the best, he really make sure everyone had a great time and joined in the fun with dancing and games. 
Xoximilco is definitely worth a visit! 100% Recommendable!

Had been putting off going to this excursion but we finally decided to give it a try as our travelling companions this trip like to drink and enjoy Mexican food/music.

Upon arrival you will be at placed in a "waiting area" and are given a sticker with the name of your gondola. I think we were given one based on us being obvious tourists and English speakers. There were probably 70% or so local Mexicans at the event. 

While waiting you can sample for free a local corn snack and some juice type drinks. There is a bar but no free alcohol until you get onboard :(

Recommend you walk down to the jetty area early and locate your gondola. They will call out your boat name when ready to let you board, but it can be hard to hear if back at the milling around area.

Once they called out Maria Bonita, our boat name, we boarded and were greeted by the host. Once everyone was on board off we went. We had a good group of fellow travelers. The gondola stops at each musical performance spot and midstream to pick up the supper.

The food is a sampling of different regional flavors. It was okay and filling enough.

Beer, tequila, rum and vodka were available. Pretty much all you can drink. They restocked at various points along the way. 

The host did a great job, unfortunately I forget his name, at entertaining and keeping the party mood going. Who is on the boat with you will definitely affect the atmosphere. Luckily our group seemed to partake appropriately. Two couples from England across from us at the table put away a bottle of tequila and a bottle of rum themselves. 

They only stopped once for a bathroom break so keep that in mind.

Will be going back again in April.

El ambiente es extraordinario para toda la familia, estuve en una trajinera donde hab√≠amos personas de 4 nacionalidades y de todas las edades desde un beb√© hasta personas de la 3ra edad, evidentemente no nos conociamos y todos nos divertimos much√≠simo, no paramos de bailar ni de re√≠r, los animadores Carlos y Darwin son incre√≠bles. Note: We were staying at Hotel Xcaret and this was part of our all-inclusive.

All the staff we had talked to at our hotel recommended this adventure.  You join a barge full of people (around 20) to float, enjoy dinner and listen to the various musical styles of the Mexican regions.  You have an energetic barge host and your gondaleer who paddles and steers your boat to all the different stops.

There are about 20 ish boats on the water at the same time, so it is impressive how the boats move around each other and co-ordinate.

Recommendation - dress comfortably, remember there are mosquitoes and be prepared to dance on your barge.  This is a fun interactive dinner experience.

Your get in the gates and the party begins, there are snacks, drinks, music and games to entertain you until you join your boat.  Use the bug repellent that they provide - your exposed skin will thank you.

On the boat our guide checked what language people spoke - English / Spanish was our group and they easily provided information in both languages.

Enjoy the open bar - self serve - tequila, margaritas, sangrita, beer, water, pop and various other beverages.  There are appetizers to start and you get to try food from the various regions this include crickets, tortillas, refried beans, pico de gallo and many other tasty bites.

As you float through the park you stop along with the other boats at the floating bands: Mariachi, marimba, etc.  Your host gets the boat dancing, playing some games and you get to meet people from different places who are there to enjoy themselves.  We had a boat that ranged in age from about 10 years of age to 60+.  Everyone was sociable and had a great time.

After a few music stops you get your dinner served from another barge, once you all have your plates with a variety of different tastes (fish, beef, rice, pork) you are off again floating through the lagoon.  The food is decent and the variety gives you the chance to sample a little of everything.  They do cater for allergies, we had 3 different allergies on the boat and they did not seem to have a problem if they knew in advance.

The crew is accommodating, they even let one of the group steer the boat.

I would definitely recommend this place for a unique and fun cultural experience.
Great tour today with our tour guides Javier and Daniel as well as our driver Hugo. Thank you guys! We loved our tour and highly recommend it!

Our family of seven (five kids aged 16-24) spent New Year's Day here. We spent the whole day and LOVED every minute of it. There were no crowds and we rarely waited in line. The park is clean and the employees are friendly. We loved the ziplines and since there were no crowds, even did them a 2nd time. But my personal favorite was swimming in the underground river. The caverns here are gorgeous and rival many caverns we have visited in the US, but here you can swim in them! Worth the money. If you have teenagers, don't miss. We did the photo pass and got quite a few great photos (it took us a few days to get into the website--probably has lots of traffic). However, next time I would get one of the lanyards with a waterproof pouch and take my own photos.

Located right next to our favorite park (xcaret that we have been to 16 times) it was our first time that we had people with us who could physically do xplor (we are 50 somethings). So it was with anticipation we went. 

Upon arrival it was a very disappointing with the horrible line up to get your helmet and wrist band. It took us 65 minutes from time we got off bus at xplor and were able to get into park after getting the gear. This is the main reason for 2 versus 4 star rating.

Once in it was okay. Big lineup to get onto the zipline route though. Had to wait for people to get their harnesses properly sized. You have choice of "deer" or "jaguar" paths. Deer being lower than the higher jaguar. We chose the jaguar. You have 14 points to climb up the stairs in the towers to get to the next zipline section. Be prepared to get wet. IMPORTANT NOTE: once you start the zipline there is no paths to walk back if you decide to quit. Apparently you can "leapfrog" at a couple towers by going from jaguar to deer as we saw one couple do. We were at tower 4 and they still had to go 3 three links to get back.

Did the ATV thing twice, once for each route. Be prepared for nervous nellies slowing you down and not moving over at the pass points to let you get by. Very rude...

You can eat as many times as you want at the restaurant. Food is okay, not great like at xcaret. 

Another IMPORTANT POINT: there is no alcoholic drinks available. You would think they were based on the number of collisions generated by the ATV idiots (saw 3 of them). :)

Probably wouldn't go back again except to maybe try the night time option. However will definitely do again if travelling with teens in the future.

O parque √© nota 10. Vale gastar um dia todo. As atividades n√£o s√£o recomendadas para crian√ßas pequenas. √â necess√°rio minimo condicionamento f√≠sico, para aproveitar (nada cansativo, por√©m). As refei√ß√µes s√£o gostosas.
Excelente experiencia para chicos y grandes, recomiendo llegar temprano para aprovechar bien el dia sin tanta fila. La comida es buena y tiene variedad.

Nous y sommes all√©s une journ√©e un peu plus froide qu'√† l'accoutum√©e pour le Mexique car nous ne savions pas quoi faire d'autre...Quelle belle journ√©e nous avons eu! Le site est tr√®s beau, bien entretenue, le personnel est accueillant et professionnel, tous les passages sous terre sont fabuleux et se doivent d'√™tre vu, c'est impressionnant comme c'est vaste! On a ador√© la tyrolienne, on a pris celle du jaguar si je ne me trompe pas mais on a vu aucun jaguar...C'est seulement la tour la plus haute des 2 parcours je crois. L'environnement y est securitaire et super bien pens√©. Le buffet est surprenant avec ceviche de fruits de mer, pates, viandes, poissons, etc. Ils sont soucieux de prot√©ger l'environnement et demande donc aux touristes de se conformer √† ses exigences afin de preserver cette nature si precieuse, vous voulez vous proteger du soleil assurez-vous d'avoir une cr√®me solaire biodegradable, ou de vous en procurer √† leur boutique.Donc en r√©sum√© on ador√© notre journ√©e, oh oui! Surtout planifier des souliers d'eau absolument sinon ils en vendent sur le site, c'est un must! Bonne visite!
Un bonito lugar para gente que le gustan las emociones fuertes muy recomendable para ir con adolescentes y la comida deliciosa

La verdad el parque es muy bueno, pero lo recomiendo para personas no muy avanzadas en edad por las actividades f√≠sicas que se realizan dentro del mismo. Las bebidas y el servicio por parte de la fuente de sodas muy buenas. Lo unico malo es que al acercarse la hora de la salida del parque (17:00), los trabajadores bajan la calidad de su servicio y hasta un poco groceros son algunos, no todos cabe aclarar, fuera de eso recomiendo vivir la aventura xplor!!

Amazing experience! Keep reading for the tips.
Plan: You should be ready to spend a whole day at this place. All the activities are super fun, the park is well maintained, food is delicious. Don't forget to buy biodegradable sunscreen in advance (any other sunscreen is forbidden, we bought one in Walmart). If you are not sure what to wear and what to bring, check out "Safety and recommendations" section on their website, it's very clear and informative.
Price: The best price you can get is if you purchase on their website at least 21 days in advance (don't forget to bring your printed ticket and ID). Bonus: they'll send you coupons for other activities like Chichen itza tour and Xcaret park) and 10% discount on their photos.
Transportation. I don't think that their transportation is worth it. We took a "colectivo" (local public minibus) from Puerto Aventuras and paid 30 pesos (taxi would cost 280 pesos) instead of paying $32 to the park. 
Pictures: If you have GoPro or at least waterproof case for your phone - bring it with you. They say that you can't use a selfie stick on ziplines but they mean that you can't unfold it because of safety. It's totally fine to hold your GoPro on a short stick or put in on your helmet. In my opinion, it's ridiculous to pay $60 for their photos. However, their system is great and automatic so the choice is yours.
Have fun!
The first park we played in Cancun. The best one in the park is the zip-lines, the vehicle is good too. The cenote rafting is ok.

What a trip! Zip lining at night, through canopy, with fireballs. Need I say more?

Awesome place! Amazing zip lines, caves(cents) are beautiful. A great day for all! My boys had a great time. Ages 13/10/8 ! Great fun for adults too!
Excelente experiencia para todos. Recomendado para loa teens. Todas las atracciones buenisimas y divertidas

Lindo parque com atividades a√©reas e subterr√¢neas. Pacote com alimenta√ß√£o inclu√≠da e uso de snorkel e outros equipamentos. N√£o gostei do m√©todo de fotos pois ao baixar acabam vindo fotos ruins e de outras pessoas.
It is not cheap place but at the and it‚Äôs worth it. The food is great too you have so many options to choose from

I love this place... Awesome time. The staff is super friendly and helpful. 

Not one complaint. If your thinking about it. Don't think just so. You won't regret it.

I will say this is more of an adventure Park. So not for the faint of heart. But not crazy either.

Este parque cuenta con 5 actividades principales: recorrido en buggy (2 opciones), tirolesa (2 recorridos), nado por t√∫neles subterr√°neos, remo en r√≠o submarino (no apto para novatos e impacientes) y acuatizaje en hamaca (tal vez la actividad menos interesante). Si tienes el tiempo suficiente y no hay tanta gente recomiendo hacer las dos rutas de tirolesa que son distintas una de la otra. Cuenta con un excelente restaurante tipo buffet con buen surtido de platos, una amplia tienda donde se compran bonitos souvenires. Altamente recomendado comprar el servicio de fotograf√≠a, pero hay que verificar despu√©s de la compra que el numero de los cascos concuerde con los n√∫meros que aparecen en el ticket de compra para evitar que te env√≠en fotos de otros grupos. No recomendable para personas de avanzada edad.

Overall, this excursion was great! It was the only one we did during our trip, as the other ones trip advisor recommended didn‚Äôt peak our interest. 

This was a fun excursion for couples. We did the nighttime Xplore and it was great, as the presence of children was few and far between (very ideal for us) (note: we are 22 and 31). 

You MUST do the zip line first. This is to ensure it is still light out to see the scenery. If you wait, you will be EXTREMELY cold and won‚Äôt see a thing. The zip line was a highlight for us!! Note: you WILL get wet. There‚Äôs no way around this, as the last line back to the main park ends with a big splash in a water basin. 

ATV vehicles: this was awesome and thrilling! The ATVs went pretty fast and it seemed to be more thrilling, as the paths were narrow and terrain was rough. It was awesome! It got cold though. Unless there is no one else in line with you for this activity, you will get held up by slower people ahead of you. This was pretty annoying but it was awesome. Felt rugged and very adventurous. Also a top activity for us that we wish we did again. Note: you will also get wet if you fly through the puddles, if not, bring a sweatshirt as it‚Äôs cold in the dark forest! 

Rafts: it was very warm in the caves on the rafts, which was nice. Got slightly woozy toward the end. You paddle your own raft with handheld small paddles that look like sandals attached to your hands. Kind of goofy but effective for the most part. The stalactites and stalagmites are really cool. 

River swim: There‚Äôs a 5 minute route or a 30 minute route. We opted for 5 minute route, as the water was really cold. The life jackets made it very hard to move. The end of the route you go in a sort of man made waterfall area and it‚Äôs hard to get through as it comes right down on you in a large area and it‚Äôs disorienting. We only did this activity to be able to say we did all of the activities but I‚Äôd skip this if we came to Xplore again. The raft ride gives you the same ambiance without the hassle of getting soaking wet and freezing cold. 

Restaurant: surprisingly impressive spread! Served buffet style and there was something for everyone. A couple of salad choices, different meats, pastas, salad/veggie bar, fruit, desserts, warm drinks, etc.

Photography: We refused to pay $60 for the iffy quality photos that were taken of us throughout the trip. It was fun posing for the 25+ photo stations, but we opted to just enjoy the moment and rely on our memories. Xplore sells waterproof cases to enable people to take their own photos but we didn‚Äôt do this either. These gimmicks were $30. Not worth it. You can do it, but I wouldn‚Äôt advise it. I would trust a piece of plastic to protect my $1000 iPhone, especially as all activities you get very wet in. No thanks. 

Wardrobe: many reviews say do not wear flip flops but that‚Äôs what we did and it work out great. We held them around our wrists on the zip line and took them off while swimming. I‚Äôm not one for water shoes, but those would work well too (note: Keens, Tevas, or Crocs would do well here). Again, you‚Äôll be cold during the night Xplore. I wouldn‚Äôt advise wearing just a swim suit. I wore all dry-fit clothes and a suit underneath. This was probably the best option, even though I hate walking around soaked in clothes but that‚Äôs the nature of this beast. 

Terrain: if you are not in shape, do not come to Xplore. There is a ton of walking and the zip line experience would be nearly impossible for you. It was tough enough for me as a 22 year old. I was huffing and puffing after climbing each of the 9 zip line towers. I would recommended this to the older crowd either. You may find the walkways very slippery and frightening.

Our family of 5 active teenagers last visited Xplor 5 years ago. It was good then, and excellent now. They have made massive needed improvements to really make it great.  So let's start. Get to thsee park early.  It "opens" at 9. We pulledinto the parking lot at 8:15am.  We had prepaid but it still takes a while to get started.  Head to check in which takes some time to get helmets, bands, lockers and your photo package (more on that later). That took 20 minutes plus a nice long walk to the lockers. We put everything in the lockers and already had swim trunks and water shoes on.  You can buy the cheap water shoes before you go or invest in nice ones which we did. It pays off. They also sell them at Xplor.  You will need water shoes and you will be wet almost the entire time at the park. We always do ziplines first. They are great and amazing and really fun.  Now, let's be smart here. We saw plenty of 8-10 year old kids screaming because they didn't want to go and families backtracking down the lines becuase the parents felt the kids would be ok once thy got there. Think with your brain please. Second, if you can't walk 0 floors down your office building during a fire drill, then back to your desk without needing a 30 minute rest this is not for you. There is a lot of stair climbing. And there are some serious STEEP climbs up some ladders when you get to the tops of certain towers. If you are fit, no problem. Saw plenty of elderly and out of shoe people turning back. Some wearing loafers.  We did thnot ziplines twice even though they have a sign saying you only have the "right" to do the activity once. It was a slow day and they didn't care. On to the ATV vehicles. It's smart to avoid the river swim at this point becuase your legs need a rest. The ATVs are much improved. You need to be 18 to drive. They do eyeball it and you don't need to take your ID unless you look really young and want to drive. There are no singl drivers, minimum of 2 in an ATV and max of 4. You will get wet here as well. There are two tracks and one goes through a huge waterfall and crosss a number of standing water pools. Very cool. We did the the water fall track first then went back and did the other track after lunch. YES, the ATVs are bumpy. What did you expect?  But, they are really fun. The good part about doing the ATV in this order is the lunch buffet is right outside the exit so we sat down and had a wonderful lunch which was included with admission. Plenty to eat and everyone was stuffed. Off to the underground river. You don't really swim as it is shallow enough for an adult to walk in waist/chest high water. But, water shoes would be really smart here. No snorkels or fins.  It's more scenic than anything. There is an area where bats live and fly around and hang from the ceiling. Very cool.  Now pictures. If you buy the photo package in advance it is well worth it. They have cameras all over the park on the ziplines, ATV and rivers that take wonderful pictures all by scanning your wristband.  We had over two hundred pictures from the day so well worth it. We also had a water camera and the photo deal is much better. We did not do the rafts and hand paddles section of the river. Doesn't seem smart and lots of work. We headed to the showers, cleaned up and left exhausted but thrilled from the fun we had. Everyone was tired but happy that we did it. Will do again in the coming years.

So my family purchased the photos that they take all throughout the resort which we also paid a lot of money for. Now its been almost a month and i am still hounding them for my photos. They replied only 2 times, and sent me one of my photos to confirm they were mine and then never replied again.  I paid a lot of money to go on this trip and then for the photos and I would like to have the captured memories with my family. Unfortunately this has left a very poor taste for me. I go to Mexico every year and I always go on a XPLOR excursion and i believe this year will be my last. Very Sad.

It's not cheap; we had to pay around $149 US because we didn't buy in advance. It's $108 US if you buy directly from their XPLOR website.  If you want to see what it's like, there's a 19-minute video on YouTube; just Google it.

This place was amazing. Me and my dad are adventurous and love doing things outside of the hotels and this adventure park was perfect. It had so many activities and it was a perfect place to go to spend the day.
