My family of 5 and I went to XPLOR on Christmas Day. It was crowded, but not overwhelming. I would recommend doing the zip-lines first in the morning so it isn't too hot and you can get wet by the end. They took all morning from 9-12pm. Lunch was buffet style and had very fresh food. They had a lot of options and a grill. The dessert options and ice cream weren't good. After lunch, we did rafting, river swim, then amphibious cars and finally hammock swing. Rafting wasn't that much fun, there were 30 min and 15 min options. The river swim was cool, but cold. It ended in a cenote. Amph vehicles were fun, they didn't go too fast but you can go in cave, through water, over bridges. My sister and I liked the hammock swing. 

I would recommend women/girls where shorts and a bikini tops with sneakers. Men can wear board shorts and sneakers. There's a bit of walking on the zip-lines and the river swim had a sharp bottom floor. 

Great day activity!

Came here as a cruise excursion and loved every minute of it. Karla, our guide, was great! Definitely recommend you bring comfortable shoes and a change of clothes as you will get wet. You will be exhausted at the end of the day!

Having done a whole day at Xplor, it was the best day of our 3 week holiday by far! Here are some top tips that we learnt throughout the day-
1. Buy tickets online/ at the entrance. Lots stalls/ shops in the streets claiming they can get you cheap entry but having compared both, the official website in advance (7 days or more) gets you a good discount.
2. Take water shoes. It‚Äôs a lot of walking on wet floors and getting soaked throughout the day. 
3. take a towel and leave in your locker. You can‚Äôt walk around and use the attractions with a towel so leave it in your locker and head back if you need to dry or warm up.
4. Take waterproof camera! The photo package is quite expensive, $70 for two people. The images did look good but we prefer to take our own.
5. The buffet lunch is really good, compared to the other parks in the area. If you are hungry enough, you can eat and drink your way through the price tag pretty easily. 
6. Do the zip lines early, we absolutely flew through and didn‚Äôt have to wait. When we saw the line after lunch it was quite long and a waste of time when you could be having fun. 
7. If it‚Äôs not due to be a really hot day, wear wet suit or suitable water clothes. It rained in the afternoon and I was cold in a bikini all day. 
8. Have fun! It‚Äôs the best park in Playa by a mile and we loved it.
Had lots of fun with the family and to pick the best part of it would be very hard.  The ziplining was good and so were the water activities.

We are in route to the Xplor Adventure Park. We were contacted and briefed by Fabian, the guide from Xplor.  Free food all day, free drinks, fres lockers, free equipment, and all helmets. No towels are provided, so you may need one.  We filled out the incident waivers on the bus enroute to the park. When we arrived at the park we had to exchange the family waiver document for family helmets and locker keys to secure everything that we brought with us. WEAR YOUR HELMET!! My wife took hers off when leaving the park and struck her head on the ceiling, sooo, don't do that! 
-You will need water shoes (any type that covers your foot like a shoe)
-‚ÄéYou will need a swim suit: guys may want the shorts type with a speed dry type shirt; girls may want to have boy type shorts on their bottom and  sturdy top that will not come off when dragged in the water by zip line.
-‚ÄéWater proof camera or water proof bag that floats for your cellphone to bring it with you to take pictures in the park. They will try to sell you one at the park for $45. They are $5 at any department store.
-‚ÄéGoPro like camera is a great option I used. You can always buy the camera package they offer for $100 USD which will provide all your pictures in digital format to your email address when you leave.
-‚ÄéThere's a juice bar that opens early and has various fruits out to snack on in the morning if you missed breakfast.
-‚ÄéThe zip line portion of the park is an activity that stretched from tower to tower taking all of 40 seconds to reach the next tower. There are quite a few stairs and a lot of climbing up and down for someone who has limited mobility. 
-‚ÄéThe Amphibious Vehicles are not that fast, but do travel under ground and through waterways, water falls, and water holes. 
-‚ÄéLunch was free at El Troglodita for everyone and included in the admissions price. The meal was a buffet and it was great option for any family to have with picky kids in tow. 
-‚ÄéYou will need a set of dry clothes and possibly other sneakers to leave the park. Walking in the wet ones could cause you to fall as my wife did as a result of the slick surfaces encountered during the trip in the park. Soooo, don't do that.
-‚ÄéThere is a paddle boat experience that would be good to tire out the kids, but bad for adults who are not in paddle boat condition for (15) minutes. Definitely send the kids on this one, ALONE, and meet them on the other side when they are dog tired, huffing and puffing. That's the best type of kid to bring home!!

So overall was some fun activities but for the price so over rated.

Our teenage kids loved this place!  And, so did the adults!  It's a great place to try out zip lining if you've never gone before.  Make sure you buy your tickets with the photo pass online.  There's a discount for advance purchase, and the photo pass costs way less online if you book as a group over the internet.  Also, the amphibious vehicles can only be driven by those 18 years and over.  If your teen looks younger, it's a good idea to bring photo ID.  Our 18 year old was not allowed to drive and that was upsetting.  All in all, we had the best time here.  Food & drinks are available all day.

There were 8 of us in the group and we had a great time.  We've gone ziplining in Cancun before but not here.  These ziplines were WAY better then what we did the last time.  The vehicle drive was pretty cool, we were stuck behind some slow pokes but it was alright.  Water was cold in the river swim (we took the long route) but I don't regret it for a second.  We loved this place and it's a memory we'll never forget. 

A nice feature is there are cameras literally everywhere.  You can take as much pictures as you want and download them after the trip.  The included lunch buffet was also delicious, tons of food choices.  Make sure to bring water shoes.

What an awesome place and quite the adventure.  Thanks for a great time!

Wow!  What a great day at Xplor.  My first time doing a zip line - conquered my fear and did both circuits!  Loved the underground river swim, beautiful stalactites and stalagmites everywhere.  Everything about the park is great. Tips - wear water shoes, buy the photo package, grab a snack before you leave the park because all food in the park is free, but as you leave you have to pay for drinks and popcorn/chips.  Glad we waited to do this until the day before going home because we are sore and tired.  Great end to our Cancun vacation celebrating our 25th anniversary!

Xplor is one of the best adventure parks that I‚Äôve been to. I loved the way the attractions are intertwined with each other, and you keep getting surprised throughout the day. The zip lines are a true adrenaline rush taking you up up up with each line until you‚Äôre able to see the entire park. What a view! The ATVs take you on a real life Indiana Jones ride through the jungle, across swinging bridges, and dark caves. The raft and river swim attractions are done so well with the lighting and let you truly enjoy the beauty of the underground caves. Since the restaurant and refreshment counters provide all included drinks and food, you never have to worry about carrying your wallet. Highly recommend purchasing the photo package as there are cameras all through the park taking photos of you in action! As others have suggested, do the zip lines first thing, then the ATVs, lunch, river float and swim. Make sure you do this one if you‚Äôre in th area!

This place was amazing and run about as efficiently as Disney World! We had an unbelievable time. The place was immaculate and the grounds were absolutely stunning. Even my six-year-old went on the zip line and had a great time. We did everything that they had to offer. The zip lines, the ATV ride, The underwater cave swimming and rafting etc. The buffet lunch was extraordinary with the selection. And the place where they had refreshments for you had the most unbelievable juice bar. They had delicious choices of drinks and blended juices to try. They also had a whole array of different coffee drinks and hot chocolate. My advice is to arrive at least 15 to 20 minutes before it opens. We got there at about 8:45 AM and we went on our first zip lineAt about 9:45 AM. It just takes a while to register get your helmets put your stuff in the lockers get suited up for the zip lining etc. we stayed there all day and left at about 5 PM. It really was a spectacular day and we highly recommend it!

I am over 64 years old and thoroughly enjoyed the zip lines. It was raining very heavily as we were in the middle of a thunderstorm but it was great fun although somewhat wet. The whole park is fantastic even in the rain. The reason I only give it 4 stars is because the ATV experience is pretty useless as you are not allowed to go over 20 miles an hour and there are no life guards in the underground pool. There are some at the beginning and some at the end, but if you get into difficulty half way round you're left to your own devices.

This place is for the adventure enthusiasts for sure. They have unbelievable zip lines, quad trails, rafting and so much more! It was raining the whole time we were there and we didn‚Äôt even notice because we were having so much fun!  The food was great....huge buffet style with tons of options to choose from!  FYI all of the tours in this area make you have environmentally friendly sunscreen and bug spray and yes they check your bottles of it and so I recommend buying some before you get to the parks cause the stuff they sell there is crazy expensive!  I brought baby sunscreen and they were totally fine with it!

It was a very fun day with about 15 other people.  The zip lines were my favorite, but I also loved the all-terrain vehicles & I had fun paddling through the cave.  It's good to wear a swim suit with board shorts that can dry quickly & take dry clothes to change into.  We took their bus, but were ready to leave well before they were to pick us up & took a cab back instead.
When to Explor park in the early evening great fun and the zip lines where awesome, would definitely go again

We ignored the bad reviews and decided to go and see for ourselves. I am glad we did. The park is clean. The rides are awesome. The zip lining is amazing!! We had a great day. So much adventure in one place.

The buffet food is very good. No complaints. 

Would 100% recommend it. The only negative was the ticket process which took a while but everything after that made up for it.

Este parque √© muito bom para quem gosta de uma divers√£o como tiroleza, nado em cenotes, andar em cavernas, andar com uma especie de bug e gosta de comer a vontade! Al√©m de tantas atra√ß√µes que toma f√°cil o dia todo h√° um buffet de comidas a vontade muito farto, variado e gostoso. Os funcion√°rios s√£o todos simpaticos e passam muita seguran√ßa! Xplor es un parque interesante para este lugar y para pasar un d√≠a verdaderamente diferente. Es divertido en familia y con amigos , solo o en grupo. Es entusiasmante al punto de querer volver.

My family of 4 had a great time.  I didn't know if my 9 year old would like it but he loved it. We did a lot of tandem rides together.  Important - Bring aqua socks or water shoes. They sell them for about $30 but Walmart has them for about 1/2 of this price.  You could go barefoot but it is not as comfortable.  You end up in the water so tennis shoes are not the way to go.  We did a tour bus but arrived early and did both zip line options first.  We had no waiting in line!  It was great.  Then we did the swim through the cenotes.  The cenotes are so beautiful and large.  You even drive the ATVs through them.  The water in the cenote is cold but doable.  The paddling of the rafts was difficult with a 9 year old but then some adults really struggled too.  We ate lunch and then did the ATVs.  It really fills your day and if it is busy you might not be able to complete all the activities.  It was pricy but it was the favorite part of the vacation.  The people in charge of the zip lines were very careful and we felt very safe.  The "smoothies" had some unique flavors.  They were not my favorite.
Great place to go in Playa del Carmen, we choose the night pass, this is the place for some action..

Fomos com uma crian√ßa de 6anos e uma adolescente de 15 anos. V√° de sapatilha pr√≥pria para praia ou um cal√ßado do estilo papete. Na compra do ingresso, j√° est√° incluso a refei√ß√£o, bebidas (h√° um local onde fica dispon√≠vel suco e √°gua) e o transporte. Portanto, n√£o h√° necessidade de levar dinheiro (somente se quiser os souvenir). Exigem a utiliza√ß√£o de protetor solar e repelente biodegrad√°vel. Caso voc√™ n√£o tenha, eles comercializam l√°. Leve  documentos e uma toalha (para uma ducha ap√≥s o passeio). Na entrada voc√™ dever√° deixar seus pertences no arm√°rio.
As atividades s√£o super seguras e muito radicais!!
Recomendo o passeio!

Fun thrilled adventure park with 5 different activities you can choose from.  Two different zip line courses with about 8 lines in each course.  Raft through cenotes.  Swim through cenotes.  ATV course is fun and takes about 25 min give or take per route.
The layout can be pretty confusing when you arrive since it is the off season and they are not fully staffed.  The entrance seemed very gloomy and quiet.  Not too much direction in where to start or where to go to check in.  They also allow smoking near the lockers which is horrible being that it is a nature and eco friendly park.  I didn't eat at the restaurant but you get a meal included with your entry.

Highlights are the Ziplines, rafting through the caves and the buggies. Buggies were loads of fun and much longer than expected each track 5+KM through waterfalls, caves and river crossings...you get wet!  Paddling through the caves was extraordinary. Would never get to see something like this up close in the US...you get wet. And finally the Ziplines. Awesome and terrifying!  6-7 interconnected towers take you all over the park and then though a waterfall...you get wet.  Unlike any experience I have done. A must-do.
Es muy bueno si te gusta la aventura, las tirolesas y el v√©rtigo. El r√≠o es bueno si quieres algo tranquilo y el nado entre las estalactitas igual. S√≥lo hay un restaurante.
Este parque es el mejor de todo Cancun las atracciones son de adulto y el restaurante lo m√°ximo, todo es muy bueno.
We were busy the entire day with activities! The underground rivers were the best part in my opinion! I wish we would have had time to do them a second time.

I went to this park last year and really enjoyed it.  I am an old lady, so I thought it was impressive that I was able to do 14 zip lines.  It is well laid out, and they are very concerned about safety.  When they put you in the harness they do not let go of you until you take off.  I thought is would be a bit scary, but it was easy, and sooo fun.  Great underground water ways you can explore on a boat, all in very well done.  Not cheap, but they give you a lot for your money.

From driving through caves in the amphibious vehicles to zip lining across the jungle canopy before landing in water at the end. It‚Äôs a hell of an experience. Swimming through real caves before an all you can eat buffet and drink why more could you want.

Not for people wanting a relaxing day, best done on a day that is warm but maybe a bit of cloud to keep the sun off.

If you are lucky enough to get a quiet day you will have an even better time

Andar de noche en la selva con los anfibios o carritos dise√±ados para lugares de dif√≠cil acceso llena de adrenalina la tiroleza y pasar por cuebas von estalactitas ,s√∫per maravilloso toda  una experiencia .les contar√≠a m√°s pero mejor tenien q vivirlo

Fui a Xplor y me encanto, en el grupo que con el que iba hab√≠a unas personas que eran mas grandes que nosotros y pensamos que no se iban a subir a las tirolesas y para nuestra sorpresa las disfrutaron como ni√±os.

No importa la edad que tengan la gente se divierte en el parque.

Un parque de aventura muy bello, la comida no es tan buena pero las actividades si .
Es un parque algo caro y peque√±o pero vale la pena , en un d√≠a logras realizar todas las actividades . El r√≠o con estalactitas es simplemente hermoso , recuerden llevar camisas t√©rmicas y zapatos de agua y con solo esto pasar√°s un d√≠a fenomenal .

With a focus on hitting the ziplines, cave walk/swim and cave canoe, plus one side by side ride, the day flew by!  Buffet was great.  

Side by side: Really, really slow.  I would leave that for last, and ensure you have done everything first.  Ziplines were top notch; great views and good arrests (I am 250 lbs, and hit those stops HARD!).  No issues.

Fui con mi hijo de 12 a√±os sin saber bien a donde iba en realidad, fue sin ver ni leer folleto, nos vendieron el paquete en el hotel y nos fuimos. Muy buenas las atracciones, las tirolesas muy buenas, el anfibio excelente y divertido y nadar por cuevas de noche (iluminadas) es algo muy bueno realmente. Went here with a small group from 12 to 60. Be prepared for lots of waking up stairs but it's so worth it once you see the views from the zip lines. The dune buggies were my favorite part. If you don't want to be wet right before you leave then don't do the zip lines last as the very last zip line takes you into a large pool of water.

This is a for sure YES for your bucket list. I never had so much fun in all my life. I cannot wait to go do this again. Zip lines, driving ATV's over bridges, in & out of caves, swimming in a cave and did I mention caves? The whole center HUB is in the CAVE!  And I have a fear of heights but with these sip lines I didn't fear a thing.

Wasn't the hottest day but that didn't matter.  Really surprised how efficient all the activities were and how the place never seemed overly busy even though we knew there was many, many people there.  The food was great!  I'd recommend leaving the phone/camera in the locker and just focus on using all the in house cameras.  It costs $70 to get all your photos but if you make sure to hit them all, the quality is high and the angles are great.  You can end up with about 100 pics if you really work at it.

How awesome is this place!  We arrived early and got right to doing the Zip lines.  We went through each of the courses which were amazing. We wore our suits to Xplor and water shoes all day.  We then changed into our dry clothes at the end of the day as others have mentioned.  The locker setup was excellent and the place is easy to find your way around.  

This is a great tour!
the zip line was our 1st experience wow what a great felling that was. also the cenotes where very nice to visit

Conquered my fear of heights and went on the ziplines - amazing, and yes I was still scared but did it as an almost 50 year old mom of 5 boys.  Had a great day doing all the activities.  Underground river swim is amazing.  ATV ride is fun, not as fast as I thought it would be, but fun going through the caves and jungle.  Make sure you wear water shoes.

realmente el ir a Explor es tener un d√≠a lleno de actividad f√≠sica pero vale la peno sin duda , cuenta con dos tramos de tirolesas estupendas, los carros anfibios son geniales as√≠ como el rio subterraneo, les recomiendo los licuados que sirven! son exquisitos!, lleguen temprano para aprovechar todo el parque

This was the best money we spent on a tour ! It rained 1/4 of the day and made the lines shorter and the rides more fun .Make sure to bring a camera to record the fun

Muy bueno, lo mejor las tirolezas, a mi me gustan actividades de adrenalina moderada como ejemplo parapente, pense que este parque me daria un poco mas de emocion, es muy bueno pero no repetiria, quizas en grupos se disfruta mas por el relajo de todos. If you have kids 6 +  you are in the right place. This is something you are going to enjoy as well. Everyone is happy in this park. Thought the price was steep but once we showed up and did the first vehicle activity it was already worth the price! Super cool place, full of caves and underground tunnels. Incredibly built, ridiculous amount of ziplining and caves to explore. Will definitely go back and do the night version!

We loved this park.  There's ziplining (2 different routes), hammock zip lining, water landings, water slides, amphibious vehicles (2 different long routes through caves, and water, and over bridges), underground river swimming, and rafting. Definitely do the picture package!  Can't say enough about this park!
El tour lo ofrecen por 5 horas m√°s o menos, son 4 atracciones que se hacen en dos horas... La comida es deliciosa.

Si vas a playa del carmen y tienes un d√≠a disponible para explotarla adrenalina al m√°ximo y saber de lo que eres capaz? No dejes de visitar el parque X-Plor.... es una experiencia de lujo, tirolinas, coches para entrar en las cuevas, nadar en los r√≠os subterr√°neos, etc... pasad de todos los parques e ir a este parque!
Super fun and very well run.  Efficient staff.  Thrilling ziplines and great food.  Underground river paddle very peaceful.

I'm really glad I could be there because I enjoyed all activities. We were there in dusk, so zip lines together with lighted towers looked very impressively. The driving carts during the night jungle was such amazing.

Xplor was amazing and a MUST if you are in Cancun!  There are five main attractions you can chose from and we did every one and it was highly worth it! We booked our tickets the day before through the travel agent in our hotel.  Our price was higher than booking through the site, but we were doing it last minute.  We took our two sons - age 11 and 15 and this was the highlight of the trip.  Most everything has been covered by other reviews - but a few things to note...
1) take dry clothes
2) take a towel
3) buy the photo package (AND SAVE YOUR RECEIPT AND PHOTO BRACELET!!  We didn't do this and didn't have our download code when we got home and had to call Xplor,etc.  They were fantastic and helped us get our photos but best to avoid all of this).
4) do the 2 zip lines first - this way you avoid the line where you get the gear (there are basically two lines - one to get the gear and fitted and one to get on the zip line).  Both zip lines are great!
5) do the cave rafting last - there is a short option and a long option, so if you run out of time you can do the short version on this one
I would highly recommend this trip!  We are very safety conscious and we always felt very safe and the staff was very professional!

I've been to all the parks here and this one is the best in my opinion. A great way to spend an entire day

Compramos pelo site 7 dias antes com desconto (demorei para decidir se √≠amos ou n√£o pelos coment√°rios de que √© um parque muito radical), mas resolvemos encarar e sem arrependimentos. Parque organizado e muito limpo. Usamos 2 arm√°rios, somos em 4. Uma dica importante, deixe as tirolesas para a tarde, ficamos uma hora e meia na fila de manh√£ , fomos na mais baixa, super tranquilo, todos iam para a mais alta. No final do dia conseguimos na mais alta, sem ningu√©m. Comida excelente e a vontade. S√≥ n√£o gostamos do sorvete e nem do caf√©. Deu tempo de ir em todas as atividades at√© 17 hs. Todos muito divertidos. Eles n√£o fornecem toalhas, tem que levar de casa, caso queiram se trocar.  Enfim, vale a pena, apesar do alto custo.

Xplor park will take up a full days activities.  The underground river raft and swim is excellent and the sights are breathtaking.   Never knew that nature could produce such underground caves that take your breath away.  
The raft ride is good - the short route is ideal.  The long route will appear too long and nor worth the extra 20 minutes.
it wouldn't disappoint you.

This park is amazing! It well organized and feels like your right in the middle of a beautiful jungle! The zip lines were insane but safe! The fee included unlimited beverages and food!The underground raft ride is a must! We used BD Travel they were prompt and knowledgeable.
long lines for zip lines in the morning make it difficult to do all of the attractions in 7 hours. big buffet, clean park. bring bathing suit with change of clothes because you will wet all day
This is a must when visiting Cancun! Best zip line ever and loved the amphibious vehicle. The amazing huge buffet topped it off!

The Xplor park was the most amazing excursion we did our entire trip to Riviera Maya, Mexico!! Our kids are 13 and 10 and we all did everything the park had to offer. We all had a blast! We went on New Years Day so the park was pretty empty which allowed us to do things more than once. We did the dune buggy trek as a group of four and got to go through caves and across a bridge.  We did the zip lines - that was our favorite part. There are 2 different tours for the zip lines. One has 4 normal landings and 2 water landings (keep your feet up for the water landing for sure). The other has 5 normal zip lines and 1 water landing with 2 rope bridges to cross on foot. You can do both routes included in your admission. We also swam in the underground river (cave) and we did the individual and tandem rafts in the underground river too. You wear a helmet the whole time and as your walk through the caves there are picture spots where your helmet uses a chip to identify back to your photo library along with the zip lines capturing your helmet chip and taking photos of you as you fly through the air. You can purchase your photos at the end (totally worth it). Lunch is included in park admission as well. It is a buffet lunch. Have fun and don‚Äôt miss this awesome adventure. Be ready to spend the whole day there. Enjoy!!

We had an amazing time at Xplor. My husband and I chose Xplor over Xcaret as we loved the sound of the zip lines. 

There are 2 zip lines courses you can take, each one has 7 zip lines which can be done by yourself or with a partner. Both feature some water zip lines so expect to get very wet. 

Theres a raft 'ride' where you are on a kayak like boat and are given pedals to steer around the cave, you have two options - either the long route which is around 30 minutes or the short route which is around 10 minutes.

Theres also a swimming 'ride' where you swim through the caves, again with the long and short route. 

We loved the amphibious vehicle ride where you drive around in a 'jeep' like vehicle through water and caves. Its a great laugh.

The buffet is really good with lots of choice. Staff are very friendly and helpful.

Would definitely recommend!

Es la segunda ves que visito este parque , la primera fu√© hace 5 a√±os y tristemente veo que conforme pasa el tiempo la calidad en el servicio va decayendo.
1) De todas las personas que nos atendieron en las tirolesas , sin mentir la mitad , parec√≠a que te hac√≠an un favor y te trataban de manera seca y mec√°nica .
2) Hay una chica morenita , un poco gordita de cabello medio largo ( no recuerdo el nombre ) que nos di√≥ el acceso en 2 ocasiones a los 4x4 , que b√°rbara que manera tan grosera de tratar a la gente , si no le gusta su trabajo no s√© qu√© hace ah√≠.

Tengo 2 puntos buenos que rescatar:
1) La comida y las estaciones de refrigerios son buen√≠simas, muy completas y en magnifico estado .
2) Contratamos el servicio de fotograf√≠a , por encontrarnos de viaje no pudimos descargar las fotos en el lapso que nos indicaron , pero mandamos un mail y amablemente nos mandaron las fotos .

** Un poco de capacitaci√≥n a su personal no estar√≠a mal.

You couldn‚Äôt get away with Xplor in America. Someone would slip on the wet cave floor, crash their ATV into a tree, or walk head first into a stalactite and then sue the crap out of the owners. 

This is too bad, cause Xplor is fun. Driving their suped up gas-powered golf carts (complete with roll cage) at full speed, at night; barely maintaining control as you run into a 90-degree turn at the bottom of a slope, inside a cave, through water.....is just awesome. Yes, somewhat dangerous, but not TOO dangerous. Just don‚Äôt be ridiculously stupid. (You don‚Äôt even sign a waver!)

The attractions at Xplor aren‚Äôt death-defying, but many get the adrenaline going. In America, it just couldn‚Äôt happen cause we‚Äôre too lawsuit crazy; so, we‚Äôre stuck with cars on tracks and the same tired roller coasters. [sigh]

Fun, organized, clean, easy to follow. Recommendations: 
1. Be there before 8AM
2. Start with the long ride for zip lines "Tirolesas" otherwise you will be stuck in a long queue. 
3. Use water shoes
4. Take several small snacks, instead of a a formal lunch

We weren't sure what to expect at this park but it didn't let us down. You can book either for the day time or night time, we went in the day! Entrance is expensive but it is around what most of the parks are in Mexico. Bring dry clothes as most of the activities leave you wet. Also, some sort of water shoes are essential. We ended up buying them at the park. The main attraction for us were the zip lines and they were amazing! Do  this first thing as they can't get busy. There are 2 routes. Then there is the buggies which also have 2 routes and are great fun! Lunch was great, lots of variety and the ice cream was fab! Then we did the underwater rivers. There are 2 routes that you can do in a rowing boat (short & long) and the same swimming! Both are amazing! You don't really need sun cream as the park if covered in trees etc and so not much sun gets in! There are also hammocks and animals. In all a great day out! The only complaint I would make would be regarding the pictures. You can buy a package but you can't purchase individual pictures which was a great shame. There were a couple of picture that we would of have liked to buy but that wasn't possible.

We started out on the many zip lines, some of which you go under a waterfall and land in the water in the cave. Then we explored the caves and waterfalls and found our way to the cave swim which was breathtaking. After the swim,  lunch was open if we were ready and they had a large selection of food that was included with admission. They also had small snacks and rinks throughout the park as well. After lunch we went on the buggy ride which went through water, caves and waterfalls all around the park. We spent all day at the park, but I wish I had at least another day to enjoy the park so I will definitely be back, worth every penny. I would suggest wearing shorts over your swim suit for ladies during the zip lining portion of this excursion.

todas las actividades estan divertidas
el hamacuatizaje muy padre, la comida muuuuy rica, las balsas muy bien, y anfibios muy padre el paseo
If I knew I had to climb so many stairs I would've skipped the Zip Line, but the, I would miss the experience
Better than disney in my opinion! I would totally recommend this park to family and friends alike!!!

Zipline was the best, other activities were great as well. Perfect evening activity.
The food was actually delicious!
Do not forget to bring an extra set of clothing and shoes.

Me and my husband visited Xplor and it was a fun-filled day with beautiful views. We rode the amphibious vehicle (the path is made in such a way that your vehicle has to go on a bridge and in water, through a small water fall etc), hammock splash was relaxing and fun, zip lines were pretty tall and long (we liked the option of zip lining 2 people at once), rafting in the caves was fun (and tiring at the same time). Facilities are very well maintained, food was great. We loved the option of being able to buy pictures. There will be a chip in your hat and you can pose for pictures as many times as you want for the same price (costed about $60 for both of us). We made some beautiful moments here. Would even recommend for a family with kids (above 5yrs)

Es un lugar muy bonito. Tiene actividad es que pareciera solo te tomaran un rato pero en realidad puedes estar ah√≠ todo el d√≠a sin darte cuenta. El acceso es caro pero tiene todo incluido. Las actividades son muy bonita. Lo malo es que todo es subterr√°neo o a la sombra excepto las tirolesas.

This place was AWESOME!!!  It was like an all natural Disneyland. It was so cool to get the same thrills without anything fake or digitally enhanced.  
Highlights and tips:
-Start with the ziplines - we arrived right at 9 am and did the ziplines first - no lines AT ALL!  It took about 2 hours to do all 14 ziplines.
-Lunch buffet was amazing!  There was something for everyone and you could go back as many times as you wanted.  There were also juice bars throughout the park for a quick snack or a cup of coffee.
-Lots of staff available to help.  Everything was very well marked - very professional all the way!
- They will give you as many lockers as you want.  I was hesitant to bring a lot of stuff  because I only thought they would give one locker.
-Picture package is a MUST!  We had the coolest pics from our day - and we didn't have to carry a camera or a phone around to get super pics. It was a breeze to access and download them.
-This is a VERY physical day - be ready to walk and play A LOT!  We all wore water shoes with thick soles (ie Keen, Merrell and Chacos) and my feet were still sore.  I don't know how you could do the day with anything else on your feet.
-We included a transfer in our package, but ended up taking a taxi home because we were done with everything around 2:00.  
-I bought our tixs on Black Friday which made them really affordable...look for deals on the website.
Overall this was a highlight of our trip!  So worth the $!
lots to do here. 2 Atv courses which were amazing, careful, they check to make sure you don't damage them. Lazy river raft ride was nice but got backed up.

We booked this attraction through our hotel (Riu Playacar and Lomas Travel) as it was very close to where we were staying. The whole experience is designed with a lot of thought and taste, from the entrance into the caves, to the signage and the different sections. We first went zip-lining, as it is the main attraction there. The equipment is in top condition and the operators are highly trained and do not let anything pass by. We ended up doing both circuits twice. The cherry on the cake is the landing of the last line through a waterfall. We also got to ride buggies in caves, swim and canoe on an underground river and zip down in hammocks. The buffet lunch (included) was excellent with all kinds of local delights. We also signed up for the photo package, which allows to have pictures automatically taken at the best spots in the park with a special bracelet. The shots were all fantastic and we got to download them by 5PM the next day as announced. Overall a great indoor/outdoor adventure. There is also a night option, but not all the attractions are available I was told.
Amazing!!! Must go back with kids...a highlight! Zip-lining was beyond expectations, great food, fun atmosphere. So worth the money!!

We brought our family of 12 here and it was so much fun!  It was very busy but we were early enough only the zip lines had any amount of a wait.  Loved the food, the "amphibious jeeps" were a bit of a let down and had to breathe with all the exhaust but still enjoyable.  Well worth the price.

Una manera de convivir con la naturaleza de un modo extremo, tienes carros anfibios, nadas en un r√≠o de cuevas, vas en balsa, tienes much√≠simas tirolesas, la entrada es all inclusive puedes comer y tomar lo que quieras, la comida es muy buena para desayunar y comer, todo tipo de comida y es un lugar muy m√°gico lleno de actividades y convivencia con la naturaleza!!!

Minha viagem foi realizada com minha namorada e outro casal de amigos. Est√°vamos em busca de um parque onde pud√©ssemos desfrutar de boas atra√ß√µes e tamb√©m apreciar a beleza natural do lugar. Achamos o Xplor perfeito por isso, √© o parque com o maior numero de atra√ß√µes (que para n√≥s s√£o classificadas como √≥timas) e ainda podemos aproveitar os rios naturais, etc, alem poder ver um pouco mais da regi√£o em cima das Tirolesas. 
Algumas atra√ß√µes que valem muito a pena: Circuito de Tirolesas (op√ß√£o entre as mais r√°pidas ou mais altas, podendo ir em duplas e individualmente), passeio de Bugres (dica: se voc√™ quer um trajeto um pouco mais emocionante, pegue o primeiro carrinho, se n√£o voc√™ ter√° que obrigatoriamente ficar seguindo algu√©m) e o passeio em rios naturais (√°gua gelada, mas vale muito a pena). 
H√° op√ß√£o de comprar o pacote de fotos que funciona a partir do numero do seu capacete. Um pouco caro mas dependendo das fotos vale a pena. Tem alguns lugares espalhados pelo parque onde voc√™ pode tirar fotos, al√©m de algumas atra√ß√µes tamb√©m. 
Quanto a comida e bebida, est√£o inclu√≠dos no pacote e tem bastante op√ß√£o dos dois. Resumo do parque: em um dia voc√™ consegue se divertir muito em todas as atra√ß√µes, comer e beber muito bem e tirar √≥timas fotos. N√£o faltou nada.
Excelente parque, excelente atenci√≥n al cliente, todos se preocupan por tu bienestar, vale much√≠simo la pena, el show del final es muy bueno, 100% recomendado
El mejor parque de diversiones de M√©xico
Must visit once...all activities need more than 1 day though
El r√≠o subterraneo, la torre esc√©nica y el espect√°culo nocturno es lo mejor. Excelente lugar para visitar.
Todo genial si puedes ir 2 d√≠as para disfrutar todo vale la pena.
Una experiencia inolvidable
Amazing and beautiful. Great place to snorkel and enjoy the waters.

We were there a few days back. The attraction itself is nice with lots of trees. I was impressed with the amount of trees they left and built around them. It is quite cooler in the park even when it is 80F outside. But then as we walked around, we found many attractions are minimal in what they have to offer. We paid extra for the X-Caret Plus and that includes Snorkeling which is good. We enjoyed that part. However, even with a $125 per day ticket for X-Caret plus, you are not even offered a towel at the end of the snorkeling. So we had a rent a towel for $4. Now get this, they charge $4 for the towel, take your picture and HOLD your drivers licence all for a used (and washed I assume ) towel. So we are forced to make our way back to the Towel Returns which closes way before the rest of the park. We were literally on the other end of the park and rushed back skipping back attractions to be on-time to return the towel and get my Driver's License back.
And we left the park and later when at the airport realized that they gave someone else's credit card! It was the same Chase Saphire card that belonged to someone else. That was the only card that I had that had a travel alert to be able to use in Mexico. So we had to call one of my other credit card companies to be able to use a credit card.
Except for that grand fiasco that added undue stress while traveling and for the over-price admission cost, it was OK. 

I would not go back again.

We weren't sure what to expect at this park but it didn't let us down. You can book either for the day time or night time, we went in the day! Entrance is expensive but it is around what most of the parks are in Mexico. Bring dry clothes as most of the activities leave you wet. Also, some sort of water shoes are essential. We ended up buying them at the park. The main attraction for us were the zip lines and they were amazing! Do  this first thing as they can't get busy. There are 2 routes. Then there is the buggies which also have 2 routes and are great fun! Lunch was great, lots of variety and the ice cream was fab! Then we did the underwater rivers. There are 2 routes that you can do in a rowing boat (short & long) and the same swimming! Both are amazing! You don't really need sun cream as the park if covered in trees etc and so not much sun gets in! There are also hammocks and animals. In all a great day out! The only complaint I would make would be regarding the pictures. You can buy a package but you can't purchase individual pictures which was a great shame. There were a couple of picture that we would of have liked to buy but that wasn't possible.

I was so unsure about visiting Xcaret but I should not have been! I kind of hate crowds/theme parks but this is not like that at all. I don't know why people don't rave about the beaches and snorkeling areas...they are so beautiful and easy to use.  I saw a manta ray 7 feet across-gulp. He came in from the ocean and then after circling awhile went back out. I also saw about 10 varieties of colorful fish. We spent 2 weeks in various parts of Mexico and Xcaret is one of the last places we went. It was such a pleasant surprise and such a nice way to cap off the trip. As others have said the shows (including the final one) is phenomenal. It made me proud of Mexico and I'm not even a citizen:-) The buffet is also top notch and includes a beer! Definitely buy the ticket that comes with a meal. The exhibits throughout were so nicely done and the river floats are pretty special too. Thoroughly enjoyed it and highly recommend!!!

My family allocated a full day of our vacation in Riviera Maya to Xcaret and I feel we got our money‚Äôs worth. We purchased the Xcaret plus package, which included a storage locker, one (and only one) buffet meal, and access to the water activities. 

Highlights:
 ‚ÄúSea Trek‚Äù  manta ray experience (extra charge).
The underground river: they have a convenient system in which you put your belongings in a bag, which they lock and provide you a key to, at the start of the river and which they take to the end of the river for you to pick up. The river itself is a lot of fun. 
The Mayan cultural shows in the evening.
The ‚Äúday of the dead‚Äù cemetery.

Tips: bring a towel (or purchase one there).
We weren‚Äôt charged for parking (had a rental car).
Lockers and changing areas enable you to change from wet to dry clothes easily and walk around unencumbered by your extra clothing.
Was able to use Visa credit card throughout park.
Xcaret plus package includes only one buffet meal; additional ones will have a charge. I think we paid about $12 USD per person at that day‚Äôs exchange rate for our second meal. Buffet is vegetarian/vegan friendly.
It was much cheaper to just buy digital copies of all of our photos than to select individual printed ones.

We bought the Xcaret Plus package with transportation and it would have been a good deal if it hadn‚Äôt been so packed. The bus pick up is at the hotel at 7am arriving at the park around 9am, there are 2 schedules for the return 4:45 and 9:40pm. We stayed for the late departure and enjoyed the show at the end of the day, the bufete was good, they give you a brand new straw for snorkeling, and in general it is all good. The only reason we didn‚Äôt have a great experience is that we went during the week between Christmas and New Year, the place was so packed you couldn‚Äôt swim or snorkel without kicking or getting kicked by someone else. I think I would have rather have been denied tickets for those dates than going into a park packed to the gills. We also got the pictures package but the park was so full 90% of our pictures have a bunch of strangers in them. I haven‚Äôt been able to download the pictures and I‚Äôm still waiting for their support team to get back with any kind of answers. The place is beautiful and I‚Äôm sure any other time it would have made for a great visit, but for us was a terrible first impression.

We had been to this park for our honeymoon 18 years ago, and it's amazing how much it has grown.  So much, in fact, that a day is definitely not enough.  I would recommend planning for the two-day package, and splitting it so as to have a "wet" (all water activities, sectors green, blue and red) and a "dry" day (no water activities, sectors black and white).  The Mexico Espectacular show in the evening is definitely a must, including a full-fledged Maya football game, historical reenactments and Mexican traditional music and dances, carefully choreographed and staged.  I recommend watching it from mid-level (neither too low nor too high), but you'll need to get there early, because it gets full.  The horse show is also great.  We saw the Voladores de Papantla, but if you miss that, a small-scale recreation is part of the evening show.  The butterflies and the aviary are really huge and impressive, much better than anything else I had ever seen.  There are several free workshops available, and I strongly recommend planning to attend one.  We went to the chocolate one and got to make chocolate paste from the toasted beans, following the traditional methods, accompanied by an excellent (bilingual!) explanation.  Those 45 minutes really added a lot of value to our experience!  Just like in Xel-ha, food at the restaurants is truly excellent.  The only real issue we had is that use of towels is not included, and while they are available, you need to bring money to rent them, which was an awkward surprise at the end of the river swim, and meant we had to walk all the way back dripping.  There is free Wi-Fi on the park, although I wish there had been a web or app map rather than use the paper ones.  Another issue is that the logistics for the return trip were not well organized and the walkway is dark, so it got confusing when everyone came out at the end of the show and had only minutes to get to the right bus for the ride back.

It is a beautiful place with a lot of great tropical scenery.  We were dropped off at 9am when the park opened and picked up at 4:45pm. Many of the activities required additional cost, and there weren‚Äôt enough ‚Äòincluded‚Äô activities to spend all that time there. We did enjoy the 45 minute swim through the underground caves/river. If you bring your own snorkel gear, you can see all the fish that are swimming with you :) the butterfly exhibit was a let down in the first area (not a single butterfly) but when you get to subsequent areas there are more butterflies. They have a cemetery with beautiful memorials that form a spiral up a hill. The flamingos were fun to watch. We had a good laugh at their antics and trying to figure out what they were up to. The raft ride was boring. The orchids were beautiful. The beach was nice but it was extremely crowded so it was hard to be in the water without bumping into people.  Most lunch options are included. We chose the seafood buffet that cost extra but it was lacking on seafood. Not recommended. Bottom line is that I would recommend xplor instead of xcaret.

Este parque es una locura aunque es algo costoso para el cambio de algunos pa√≠ses los vale, es realmente sensacional el lugar, las cosas que hay que hacer, ver y disfrutar son muchas y como recomendaci√≥n entras alas 9am y esperar el √∫ltimo show que termina a las 9pm aunque es tiempo es demasiado corto la experiencia es √∫nica todo lo vale. Pagar las fotos tambi√©n las vale esos recursos ser√°n √∫nicos.

Top tip- buy your tickets online! There are lots of stalls and shops in the town centre of Playa selling packages which turned out to be quite expensive in comparison. The earlier you buy them online the cheaper it will be. We got a taxi from Playa town (220 peso) and paid upon arrival for the plus package which included a buffet lunch. The park wasn‚Äôt very busy first thing, but we later realised that many of the coaches and large groups don‚Äôt arrive until late morning. So I advise to get there as early as poss to avoid the large crowds. And man it gets busy!!!!!! 
We decided to pay the extra $39 each and swim with sting rays which was a good experience. But we took a pass on swimming with the dolphins and nurse shark, just because it was so expensive. 
The rest of the activities and shows are very family orientated, not much else to do for a couple in our 30‚Äôs that kept us very entertained. 
The lunch was OK. We had the buffet lunch included in our ticket price, but would have been $30 each if we hadn‚Äôt. Worked out about the same. They had a good selection of meat, fish, veg and salad etc. However, having seen some of the smaller lunch vendors that sold simple sandwiches for much less money, we wish we hadn‚Äôt paid the extra for the Plus package, because there is no way we ate a combined $60 worth of food for lunch! 
The snacks and drinks throughout the day were more reasonable though, so you could always snack on crisps and popcorn and eat a bigger evening meal to save more.
We didn‚Äôt stay for the evening show because again, it would have been an extra on top of a very expensive day so far! 
If you have kids- you‚Äôll love it. For the more The Adrenalin seekers reading this, there are other sister-parks that may be more enjoyable for you.

There are only three things that really impressed me at Xcaret. Two are surcharged.

Sea Trek: Such an unique experience! You literally walk on the bottom(20ft under) of the sea, surrounded by countless fish, couples of statue and even stingrays! Definitely the top highlight of our entire Cancun trip! Worth every penny we spent on it!

Photo package: not all photos are great but the great ones are irreplaceable, especially the ones with parrots and Sea Trek

Night show: we are not familiar with Mexican or Mayan culture. It was not easy to understand but really fun to watch. A little bit long though. But busses are all waiting outside so no worries about transportation.

Besides these, I was quite disappointed by the arrangement and management of the park.
Things I wish I knew ahead of time: 
1. Go to underwater in the afternoon!!! Like 3pm. We went around 11am and it was awfully crowded and noisy. No private space at all! It was a nightmare! 
2. No need to bring water shoes because they provide fins
3. No need to buy xcaret plus because food was just okay and lockers are not really necessary.
4. No one checked your sunscreen

Pricey and overly crowded. I would not go again. Sea trek is a must if you plan to go. Otherwise nothing special.

El parque es fascinante, enorme, lleno de atracciones para todo tipo de p√∫blico. Pero por encima de todo, debo reconocer que el show de la noche es uno de los espect√°culos mas memorable que visto en mi vida. No solo lo recomendar√≠a sino que volver√≠a con gusto.

The GOOD:

My children are 15 and 18 yrs old. They did the Dolphin encounter and we paid extra for a private session. Well worth the extra money as my kids really experienced the Dolphin encounter with many many many more activities. My kids were all smiles and my 15 yrs old kept saying "i want a pet dolphin". Their guide was amazing! We purchased the tier 3 photo package which included all the pictures (in a external key and DVD and app) and a beautiful picture album book. It was expensive ($362 U.S) but worth the money! There are 2 dolphin encounter areas. Our Sunwing rep at the hotel (we stayed at Barcelo Maya Palace) advised us to chose the one further from the main attraction areas as it was not as busy....the best advise ever! Lunch, snorkel  equipment, towels and locker (a down payment of $50 US was needed but you get this money back when you return your towels/locker key) was included with the package (we paid $962 CAD, for 5 adults, on the Sunwing plane, on route to Mexico, as we paid in Canadian dollars instead of US). If you purchase at the hotel, you pay in US or pesos. There are multiple areas in the resort where you can enjoy quietness but most areas are occupied and it's a 1st come. We found a place that had a slide going into a area of the sea where rocks keep the swimming area calm....beautiful! Many buffet restaurants to choose from which is included with our package. There were shows at night. We were not able to see the main show as it was busy and lots and lots of people. We did see a Mexican rodeo and a Mayan show and it was wonderful and entertaining. There are vendors throughout the park you can purchase authentic Mayan things (blankets, hats, etc). There are 2 beautiful catholic churches....one on the hill in a hut and one by the main entrance called Ourady of Guadalupe (see pictures of both churches). There is also a cemetery of ancient Mayans buried. Make sure you visit the basement of this cemetery as there is a beautiful statue of Momma Mary and a woman saint (see picture). There are Mayan ruins you can also visit that will take you back in time....so wonderful! There is a zoo (butterflies, panther, jaguar, etc) in the resort but not the greatest especially since I am from Canada and we have an amazing zoo in Toronto. There are many water activities you can do and buy (Not included with the package) but the best is the Dolphin encounter. We did one of 2 snorkel paths in the caves. There is also a snorkel area by one of the lagoons we did.

The NOT SO GOOD:

It was soooooooooo busy and over crowded. My husband and I visited Xcaret 20 years ago when Xcaret was only 5 years old. My husband's family owned a time share and visited Mexico and Xcaret frequently and I visited with my friends when I stayed in Cancun 20 years ago. My husband and I chose Xcaret because we wanted our kids to experience this beautiful place we visited 20 years ago. Well.....totally a different experience this time around and nothing like 20 years ago. This time....Xcaret became a "Disney world like resort"....overcrowded, with sometimes rude people bumping into you. The restaurants were over crowded and wait time for a table is long. The snorkel area by the lagoon is WAY OVERCROWDED and my husband and I wondered how it was even safe to have that many people in one area swimming? You didn't really see anything while snorkeling as it was so crowded....it scared the fishes away. My husband and I were disappointed and expected Xcaret to be how it was 20 years ago. 20 years ago, when you first entered Xcaret, you are instantly welcomed with an open space where all you see are the white sands, the sea, the lagoon and one restaurant on the hill with one dolphin encounter. The scenery was just breath taking. It was like the scene in the movie The Blue Lagoon with jungles in the back ground. I felt like I died and went to heaven 20 years ago. It was not busy at all back than. And it was almost an untouched resort....all natural. I remember when snorkeling in the cave pathways, I saw lots of fish. I didn't see one in this same snorkel area this time around, and it was overcrowded and people knocked into you, especially the areas where it was sooooooo dark and no lights (thank goodness for my FitBit Ionic that has a flashlight app). You need to make sure you do not get kicked on the head with someone swimming. This place became an over crowded touristy resort that got rid of the natural beauty, people like myself crave for. My husband and I said that if we knew how much Xcaret changed, we would have chosen another excursion that was cheaper and not as developed. The staff who worked in Xcaret are not the friendliest. So don't expect a smile and an "hola" from many of the staff. The lunch (that's included in the package) was ok. It's a buffet so you get lots of food to eat and chose from, but not the best tasting (at least in the restaurant we chose that is beside the turtle area). I was told the restaurant (I believe #21 and 40) are the best ones, but who knows. We weren't able to see the main show as our bus was picking us up at 8pm and the main show started at 7:30pm......and it was soooooooooo busy and packed! There is no seat reservation unless you purchase the VIP which is expensive (includes reserve seating, dinner and all you can drink wine). At the end of the day....at the bus pick up area, the line up was huge! Like huge! Don't get lost and miss your bus back to your resort hotel!

Overall, Xcaret is a great place to visit if you do not mind the touristy kind of resort that is very very overcrowded and the very expensive entrance fee. But the Dolphin encounter was the best and extra payment for this excursion was worth it! 

If I can recommend another place we visited, while on this same vacation, is the Extreme excursion with ATV, zip lining and snorkeling in a beautiful cave, and they feed you lunch! It's cheaper and the resort is in a jungle.....yes folks....in a beautiful jungle! Bring either running shoes or water shoes as you will need this. Bring towels as well as the resort does not provide towels. You do have lockers that is included. If you go, ask for Jimmy as your guide. We paid extra for a private tour with Jimmy and my family only. Jimmy was the funniest and kindest tour guide. He will make you smile and laugh until you pee your pants! We tipped Jimmy $50 US and he was worth every penny! 

GOD bless!

This is a very expensive place, for almost anyone (including myself).

But I can certainly assure this place is worth the money, (at least the general entry ticket fare)

You cannot miss the night show at the inside theater, there is nothing else like it!

Its a paradise in all aspects, and you will have lots of fun, especially if you like water/swimming/aquariums 

I didn't pay anything extra inside the park 
But I paid the premium ticket with meal, locker, and transportation to my Hotel at Cancun area, all these are totally worth it, as otherwise, you will have to pay more for the locker and the meals anyway, and the park is something like 80km to Cancun Hotel Strip, which will cost you a fortune in taxi cab, and if you are bringing a car prepare to pay no little parking fee.

Also you will spend a whole day in here because its a marvelous place.(and because of the distance of traveling if you are not staying in a nearby  Riviera Maya hotel)

Be sure to get transportation with the xcaret company (xperiencias xcaret) because they are logistics wizards and will make the difference between having a nice trip to the park or not.
Also you will get discount for buying entries to other parks (Xelha is the very definition of paradise, you might want to go there also)

Be careful to avoid buying transportation from third parties as I think that would not be a safe bet in terms of quality of service.

Anyway, inside the park lots of activities are extra, and you can purchase any you may like at something around $50 usd per person, it will sum up pretty quickly if you decide to go for them.

I couldn't afford to take any extra activity but I guess one or two of them would be a nice touch to your trip, but I think that some of them are not worth it, like swimming with some animals (except dolphins) or using a scuba like helmet because you can snorkel without paying extra. 

There is also a nice photo package with self-service cameras all around the park, even inside water attraction like in the underground river, you just need one package per group I guess, as you can take the pictures with the barcode of the wristband of one person, and get all the pictures you like, even for other persons of your party.

Also, you can buy water protecting case for your phone to take your own pictures, either option would be nice if you like pictures

Definitivamente es una gran experiencia visitar xcaret, hay varias actividades que puedes realizar, algunas m√°s extremas que otras, as√≠ que realmente puedes encontrar actividades para el gusto de los diferentes integrantes de la familia. So, to begin, my review is tainted. We travelled with two very young children, 6 and 4. We paid half price for the 6 year old and my 4 year old was free: nice, or so we thought. There is a SIGNIFICANT amount of walking on not always easy to navigate terrain and, further, there were quite a few things not appropriate for children as young as my kids were, including snorkel equipment that doesn't fit, which means we had to carry them through the rivers and couldn't do a whole lot in the snorkel coves. Plus, taking the resort tour option means a 7am departure from the hotel zone in Cancun and a 10:30pm return after the show. Again, not great for the young ones. We understand there's a 4:45 departure; however, that's too early. If your kids are older. Perhaps 7-9 and up, great place. Much like a very well stocked interactive metropolitan zoo. Pricey.. Fomos na praia artificial que √© bacana, no M√©xico Espetacular (show de duas horas que conta a hist√≥ria do M√©xico), na piscina natural para experimentar o snorkel e comemos no restaurante de carnes (parrillada).

DICA: compre o pacote Xcaret Plus, pois voc√™ pode deixar suas coisas no arm√°rio trancado, escolher um restaurante, 1 bebida alco√≥lica, e j√° est√° inclu√≠do o aluguel da m√°scara de snorkel.

O nado foi realizado, e ap√≥s fomos para uma sala com computadores para escolhermos as fotos do √°lbum. Pasmem, um √°lbum pequeno com 18 fotos custou 100 d√≥lares. Ficou combinado que poder√≠amos pagar e pegar o √°lbum mais tarde ne loja principal do parque, que fica na entrada. A atendente nos disse que entregaria no s√°bado √†s 8 da manh√£ em nosso hotel em Playa Del Carmem (isso foi em uma quinta-feira).

Pois bem, chegou s√°bado e o √°lbum n√£o tinha sido entregue. Ap√≥s 2 semanas, o √°lbum chegou via FeDex com um valor declarado de apenas R$ 9.80 + R$ 160.80 de frete. Ou seja, a Receita Federal Brasileira cobrou bizarros R$ 214.94 de impostos pela "importa√ß√£o" deste √°lbum de US$ 3.00 que nos foi vendido a R$ 100.00. Paguei com cart√£o de cr√©dito e cobrei o reembolso da empresa respons√°vel (Delphinus), e estou esperando a transfer√™ncia para o Banco do Brasil.

We visited Cozumel in Dec 2017 on Rhapsody of the Seas. Usually we schedule our own excursions but we selected a ship's tour to the Xcaret Eco Park about 6 miles south of Playa del Carmen on the Mexican mainland. The trip was butter smooth with a special ferry to Playa, a bus waiting in town for a short ride to the park and entry into the park. And what a park! Think Disney World with nature as a theme. Beautiful grounds. Animals, birds, butterflies, fish, dolphins, turtles and so on. Great photo ops, swimming, snorkeling, aquarium and so on. It was so large the paths had colored lines - "Follow the black line to the red line. Cut over on the blue - you restaurant is just down the white line" A really fun day. Highly recommended.

This is exactly like a Mexican Disney Park.

Booked via a tour agent in Isla shopping centre few days before. Included travel one main buffet meal and snorkelling with lockers. 

Got there at 10.30ish spend 2-3 hours easily going through the caves using flippers and life jackets- surreal first time experience. Loved this. Although very rocky hit my knees few times under the water. Was so fun though!!! GOES A BIT DARK BUT HANDY WE TOOK OUR PHONE we used our phone as a torch which the other people appreciated haha

After this got changed and dried off using our clothes which we packed in advance and put in their bags which they give back to us at the end of the river.

After this we went to our dolphin interax package which we bought at the entrance on the same day.  They guy was selling it for 50% discount so tried to haggle with him but he didn't budge. He said we had to book another single excursion to get 50% off so I told my Hubbie to do the foot spa with fishes as it was the next cheapest thing. 

DOLPHIN INTERAX was amazing. First time with dolphins and hubbie was super scared of dolphins but I made him come with me as I knew he would not regret it!
The package was great although was only 30minutes. Wish I could have spent more time with the dolphins but we had a group of 10 which took time for everyone to take photos with the dolphin. Next time I would do the primax dolphin package as the dolphins do a lot more and we got to watch the others do primax. Looked more entertaining. 
After this we bought 2 printed photos in a dolphin wooden frame, USB with all photos and video package all for $150 and thisnwas with haggling. Easy enough to haggle. Worth getting some pics otherwise no point really doing the dolphin package. 

HIGHLY RECOMMEND- 
+buy aqua shoes from walmart in advance
+get a waterproof phone cover to take pics
+do dolphin primax for extra charge but great and professional and fun experience
+buy photos, videos from dolphin agents but must HAGGLE

Me dijo que no era cierto, que el valor eran USD 100 por persona, ante el valor me abstuve de comprarlo y pagu√© por nadar con las Mantarayas.  Pasada una hora, en el parque, se nos acerca una persona del puesto de ventas del parque, de las mismas que me hab√≠a atendido, y nos ofrece de frente nadar con delfines por USD 50, es decir, el 50% menos que en la entrada. The other downfall is at the end of the night, after the show the exit is extremely cramped and so if you have small children or strollers be careful. A great escape and well worth the money.

My husband and I went to Xcaret for our honeymoon, about 20 years ago.  It was an excursion option on our Carnival Cruise this month, so we jumped at the chance to return.  While visiting through the cruise line didn't give us enough time to do everything offered, it did give us a guided tour for our group of 15.  We raced through the shops, the ruins, the aviary, the butterflies, and the waterfalls, so we could get to the lazy river.  Personally, I wanted to take my time, but we just didn't have it.  We swam down the Azul leg of the river.  The water was cold, but refreshing.  We swam for about 40 minutes, enjoying the scenery and the underground portions of the swim.  It was a wonderful experience.  The park has changed a lot in 20 years, so we'd like to go back to spend a full day enjoying all it has to offer.

We ended the excursion by eating at one of the restaurants in the park.  The food was AMAZING and authentic, not at all like the Mexican food we get at home.

I would absolutely recommend visiting the park, but I'd recommend spending an entire day there, if you can.  If you can't, some time is better than none.

Overall we had a great family day at the park, our sons are 8 and 9, and were a good age for the park.  It was well laid out, easy to understand, all of the staff were very friendly, and everyone was helpful.  We were there the week after New Years, so it was not as busy, which was great.  Our kids loved the underground river and the snorkeling area, we all enjoyed the different animals, and my wife loved the fish pedicure.  The food was average at best, but that was what I was expecting.  We took a taxi from our hotel both ways and that made the day easier, with less travel time.  We arrived just before they opened, which was a good move relative to the crowds.  We also followed the advice on Trip Advisor reviews, we dropped our gear in the lockers, then did a bunch of ‚Äúdry‚Äù activities  for a few hours, then had lunch, by that time it was warmer, and then we did the water activities.  Others have commented that the under ground river is cold, I think it is cold if you just float along on the journey, we swam and kept moving, so neither my wife nor I found it to be cold.  I would keep in mind a lot of the items are ‚Äúmanufactured‚Äù, so it is an easy way to get the feel for certain local items, but it is not authentic.  If you want a more authentic experience, and your kids are a little older, I think you should look elsewhere.  One issue is how narrow the paths are in some places, I commented to my wife that Walt Disney would roll his eyes at how tight it was.  For us it was a small annoyance, but if the park was really busy it could be an issue, it would also be an issue if you have a stroller, or someone in a wheel chair.  Overall it was great for the age of our kids and it was an easy one stop, self contained, attraction.

The park has something for any age:  Wildlife, Water, and Walks through jungle settings.  But this is also the handiwork of great science and ecology applications.  Look for the botany labs, marine biology, and agricultural science.  There's a lot of brainpower here.  For us, the main event was the big building that held Mexican artwork and historical artifacts.  You'll see reproductions of living quarters, for example that have much charm and hold memories of a culture rich in family traditions.  Look for the children's'  toy display.  My generation of US education spent little time on Latin America, not to mention our wonderful Mexcican neighbors.  We're catching up now . . . 
Dr. Bill Wallisch, Colorado Springs

We were initially put off by the price tag to this place, but quickly realized it's 100% worth the cost.  There are so many things to do and see, plus you're helping with their conservation efforts.  I can't describe everything, but quickly there is:

-swimming with dolphins
-swimming with sharks
-'lazy rivers' for floating
-horse shows
-restaurants/bars
-aviary 
-butterfly house
-animal exhibits
-massage
-those fish that nibble your feet
-so much more

There is so much to do and see, that you might not know where to start!  Grounds are maintained impeccably, and the staff was really helpful. There are maps all over so you won't get lost, and they have color-themed walkways to tell you what part of the park you're in.  

**Make sure to hit the evening show exhibiting Mexican culture! It's absolutely fantastic. Get there a bit early to get a good seat. They also have free wifi in that particular venue!  But seriously, the show was one of the highlights of our stay in Playa del Carmen.

Hacen muchos a√±os conoc√≠ Xcaret y deseaba volver a Playa del Carmen para ir a xcaret. Una decepci√≥n total. Era una romer√≠a, fuimos por el cenote rodeados de gente. Imposible gozar de algo. Xcaret is huge, and there are things to see and do for people of all ages. But, we basically wasted the first two hours of our visit wandering through relatively uninteresting areas before we found the areas really worth visiting. So here is my hint: Look at the visitor‚Äôs map, and find your way as quickly as possible to the red area, where the beaches and water activities are. We had the buffet lunch in a restaurant overlooking the sea (the lunch is included in the $129 VIP ticket but extra with the $99 regular admission); then watched the adjacent dolphin show; then wandered over to one of the beaches, found vacant loungers, ordered drinks and relaxed in the sun. 

    From there, we followed the blue sidewalk, which led us past the sea turtles, manatees, other sea creatures and the aquarium. Our ticket included the 7 p.m. stage show, but having arrived at the park before 10 a.m., we were too tired to stay for it. I would suggest arriving no earlier than Noon if you want to stay for the show. 

    The buffet restaurant we went to had a large assortment of good food, with unlimited opportunities to get back in line and replenish your plate. One man at the table next to us went back three times and a fourth time just to fill his plate with desert items. It should be enough to tide one over until the show, but, if not, there are plenty of small restaurants, cafes and bars all over the park. 

    Late in the day, it might be worth visiting the jaguar and puma enclosures. When we visited them, in late morning, we saw only one puma who was active. All of the others, and all of the Jaguars, were asleep. The aviary also is worth a visit. 

    It‚Äôs expensive, but pretty much every attraction on the Riviera Maya is expensive, and once we found our bearings, it was worth the price of admission.

Went to Xcaret in January this year. Cost was $100.00 US for the basic entrance which varies from their website so beware. FYI Mexico law states that they need ID with credit cards so be sure and take your Id with you  I did not think I would need as I took a cab and just about got turned away. I got there by cab for 310 pesos but return cab fare from the park was 350 pesos. (from,/to Grand Sirenis hotel). I did not do the float down the canal but it looked fun. The park is a zoo/aquarium with a few historical ruins in the park that have been saved. They have other activities in the park for an additional cost. You could swim with dolphins or swim with the sharks . There is a beach you can swim at as well.

The animal shows seem to be at 10 am or 4 pm so if you are going with children who would like to see the shows plan to be there earlier or later. I do not think that an all day excursion to the park would be enjoyable, as I believe the tour stays until after the evening show which I think is too long for most people and kids would be done at noon and for sure 4pm if you went at 8am on the tour bus. 

The park has some interesting animals and does a good job on explaining the importance of being eco in terms of the environment and the animals. The coral reef and turtle exhibits were interesting. The park has a small exhibit that shows a traditional Mayan village with some Mayan type crafts and souvenirs for sale. I liked the fact that they kept the historical ruins with explanations of what they were for.

It was a pleasant visit to the park but I do not feel that it was worth the cost of admission especially for families. I would save your money and take a trip to a zoo near your home .

Xcaret Eco Theme Park was truly a fascinating adventure added to our vacation.  There's so much to see and do even without adding the extra cost of the "extra' activities offered there.  Lots and lots of walking; seems confusing at first, but I would suggest  walking "one colour" at a time - they have numerous coloured paths where there are different activites/scenery.  I loved swimming in the "forever" rivers with my family, although the water is initially a little chilly.  It's hot out, so very refreshing!  The night time show was a collaboration of the history of Mexico, with lots of music and various costumes.  There were 19 family members ranging from 4 months - 71 yrs.  Good for all ages.   A fantastic must to your vacation!

I now understand why most of friends and family recommend that we visit Xcaret. This is a unique eco- theme park which offers activity for all family members. I highly recommend Sea Trek- an unforgettable under water activity. Note that this requires extra cost. The photo package is worth it- we ended up with really great family pictures. Staying late for the Mexico Espectacular show was all worth it- very entertaining and informative. I had better appreciation of the Mexican culture and history after watching the 2 hour show.I must say though that as much as I enjoyed this park, I do not anticipate visiting it again in the near future, but will definitelt recommend to anyone who visits Cancun for the first time.

There is so much to do there, we didn‚Äôt have enough time to do everything but we really enjoyed the day. The river boat ride was also amazing, we got front row seats so was able to take some fantastic photos. 

My husband also really wanted to do the underwater walk, I agreed to do it with him but I‚Äôm scared of fish so was very nervous. 
You go 6 meters deep under the sea, they put this helmet on you and a diver walks you down. You hold onto a railing all the way and there are divers who make sure you are safe. Even though I was frightened I felt safe with all the divers around. But my husband loved it, the fish swim around you, there are statues under the water to see, string rays and just an amazing experience to have. I was scared but really happy I done it because it was amazing! 

The show in the evening was fantastic, the actors were amazing, the place was beautiful, the atmosphere was like no other, myself and my husband really enjoyed it and would recommend to anyone, it‚Äôs a long day but great value for money !!!

I knew before hand that Xcaret was some kind of water-adventures park. Actually, that's what pretty much it is. Very clean and well designed for families. I have to say that if you want to enjoy XCARET to the fullest you have to spend the whole day in here. I paid for something that wasn't originally included; it was called "Xcaret Adrenalina" which basically is a tour on a fast boat (the speed increases up to 55 miles per hour). Then, the captains will do 360¬∞ turns (in a fun and safe way of course). Then your guide will make a pause, to start with the immersions into the waves (again in a fun and safe way). This activity took around 20min.
Then, I spend the whole day seeing the rest of the attractions and eating (they have really good restaurants here, the service was always really kind)
But, I want to focus on the very last activity that Xcaret offers; it is a Broadway type show called "Mexico Espectacular". I've never seen anything like this before. I've been to Cirque du Soleil but this was something else. Basically, "Mexico Espectacular is a two-hour show in which they represent the whole history and heritage of Mexico. The level of performance is magnificent (actors, actresses, costumes, music, sound effects, FX, make-up, everything was incredible). Please don't miss this show. It is worth seeing it and I am sure everyone will enjoy it.

Es un parque extremadamente grande por lo tanto un toma todo el d√≠a recorrerlo. Lo visit√© desde la ciudad de Cancun por ello recomiendo tomar un tourcon transportaci√≥n,  lo ideal para no perder tiempo es con la empresa oficial llamada "experiencias xcaret", los que te recogen en tu hotel y te regresan de noche o tarde al mismo... En lo que es el parque hay much√≠simas actividades para todos los gustos desde snorquel hasta vistas de zool√≥gicos, a considerar que solo incluye una comida en el d√≠a,  lo dem√°s es de gasto extra...  Otro punto que no se pueden perder es el show de noche que lleva el nombre de M√©xico espectacular,  el que es una gran puesta en escena que impacta. En general un inflatable en la riviera maya.
