If you are traveling with children, I recommend going to Xcaret for the evening Mexico spectacular show.  My daughters (2 and 1) were both enthralled for almost the full two-hour performance, and my older daughter is still talking about it in detail!  It is impressive on every level...history, sports, music, dancing, cultural performances, animals.  It is like a mini Olympic opening ceremony for Mexico!  Be sure to arrive early to get good seats.  

The Xcaret Park does have some animals, birds, butterflies, etc., but not as many as I expected.  The best part was the sea turtles. The beach at Xcaret is great for little ones...clean and calm with soft sand.  You need to bring your own towels along with you.  We spent about 5 hours at the park to see the animals and go to the beach.  We did the evening show a separate day.

We had a small umbrella stroller, and it was difficult to push through some parts of the white trail (butterfly pavilion, aviary, Mayan village, etc.).  Another couple had a regular baby stroller with the carrier, and I don't know how they navigated parts of the trail.  Be prepared to walk, and wear shoes that you don't mind getting wet.  There are selfie stations for the bracelet photo package, but there aren't as many as I expected, so I would recommend bringing a camera and not relying on the selfie stations.  We did the boat ride instead of swimming in the river because we had the toddlers, and it was fine, but not great.  

I think the evening show was fantastic and exceeded our expectations, while the animal component was lacking.  It feels like the park is trying to be too many different things...zoo, aquarium, cultural center, water park.  I'm glad admission was included with our resort, as I don't think I would have paid over $100 per person to walk around and look for animals and go to the beach.  The show was the single experience that would make it worth the price.
Minha segunda vez no Xcaret, este parque √© imperd√≠vel pra quem est√° na regi√£o. Tudo √© perfeito, organiza√ß√£o mil. O show √© demais.

Caso queira fazer atividades extras (nadar golfinho, etc), pode ser necess√°rio mais de 1 dia de parque. Conheci o parque todo em 1 dia, mas no ritmo Disney (ou seja, andando mto!!!)
We played the sea trek, swim with sharks. There are lots of fun. But the evening show is the best, we enjoyed time here.

First of all, this place is massive! Be prepared to do a great deal of walking and some of it can be in tight spaces. The park had no brochure maps available, so you constantly had stop and look at a stationary map to figure out where you were going. The whole park is not set up to be English-friendly, so be prepared to try and figure out what is going on yourself. The river is a lot of work do swim, so I would not recommend taking small children that are not strong swimmers. Some of the caves are very dark and this may frighten a small child. 
Most of the food products throughout the park were very reasonable priced, I never felt like we were being gouged. We did not do any tours, so I am not sure how those were. 
The dinner show is the best part about this park. The food was plentiful and the staff at the show was great. If you do not speak Spanish, they do provide a brochure in English that lets you know what is happening in each scene.

At the beginning we were hesitating to go to Xcaret thinking it was too familiar. Our hotel convinced us to not miss it. And what a surprise. This park is amazing! You feel like you are in zoo as you have so many animals to see. I particularly enjoyed the birds, butterflies, jaguars and dolphins. Also the show at night must be seen, it is incredible! 
My only disappointment was the free snorkelling area as there is no fishes. And I had one concern about the jaguars and puma wondering if ther are really enjoying to stay on such a small rock.The jaguar was making some strange noise laying at the same place for hours. I hope they are not drugging him. Also I felt some pools were looking small looking at the high number of animals (rays for example).
We had a nice time at Xcaret. It was quite crowded, however the activities are very engaging and they make it easy for you to spend a full day there.

We visited here on the 28th Dec and what a fabulous day out! As we are in our 60‚Äôs we didn‚Äôt want to swim the lazy river but took the raft-that was brilliant and only took 15 mins! The swim took 2 hours! We walked around and saw baby turtles just hatched in tanks then one month old and then 1yr old in tanks then saw giant turtles about 4-5 ft in diameter swimming next to us in another lazy river-what some fab photos! Then it was on to swimming with sharks and dolphins-we only watched! Tapirs,spider monkeys and a Puma and Jaguar-then on to the butterfly house and hundreds of beautiful butterflies landing on us and that was on two levels then on to the aviary-OMG!- that was on 3 levels with waterfalls and trees and plants and the birds-we have never seen so many colourful Macaws and parrots,Toucans,Flamingos,Pelicans,ducks and many more! They have a beach and lots of restaurants! Then we had a spectacular show from 7-9 pm of the Mayan history like their football using only their hips and arms-flame hockey-with their balls of fire-amazing! Then songs and dancing and Parrots,horses,war games-it was so jaw dropping and totally awesome! Everyone so enjoyed the performances! A definitely go to many times!

La verdad es un lugar m√°gico es impresionante que llegues y parece que lo acaban de hacer y preparar para tu llegada es Staff es muy atento, las atracciones con las que cuenta el lugar son muy divertidas y lindas, fue toda una experiencia inolvidable, el show al terminar la noche te deja sin palabras , mas de 150 personas en escena , es muy m√°gico, felicidades a Mexico y a Xcaret por esta gran experiencia.

I was very impressed with the Xcaret Park. It has so much to offer you can not do it in one single day if you plan to do everything and take your time and enjoy it. We went 2 days which was enough time. The rivers were amazing to swim in. The only thing I was disappointed in was we got there when it opened and alot of the exhibits didn't open til later and you would have to back track to go back and do them. Remember all the activities in the park are not part of you ticket price. Several activities cost extra. The show at night was very good and worth staying for. We stayed next door at the Occidental Xcaret so we did not spend money on food or drinks. We just went back and forth for lunch and dinner.
Nos pareci√≥ MUY caro. La entrada, las atracciones, la comida o el agua. La comida no fue buena, demasiada gente.

If you are staying in the Playa del Carmen, Cancun, or Cozumel area, make the time to stop by this park!  Something for everyone here!  Beautiful beach if you just want to sit around, drink and relax.  Swimming with dolphins.  Lots of animals and sea creatures to see.  The best part is the underground rivers that you can float through that take you to the beach area-- so much fun!  They even transport all of your stuff that you don't want to get wet in a duffel bag with a lock tot he end, so you don't have to leave all your stuff in a locker far away.  Very well done!  If you are only there for a day, no need to do the extras-- plenty to do for the basic admission price.  Don't miss the horse show-- it is excellent and free!  The Mexico show is the biggest attraction, but I enjoyed the horse show while drinking a margarita at a great Mexican restaurant right next to the arena-- that is the way to go!  There are lots of add-ons like swimming with dolphins, and boat rides if you are there longer, and several other X-parks I would like to visit that looked fun too!

Highlight:
1. Parrots, I just like them.
2. like the design of the park. Everywhere you stand, you have view surrounding you.
3. underground river swimming, nice!
4 photo cameras everywhere. the photo package is worth it.
5.the show at night, it is just amazing. high quality. I was touched and cried...

What I loved about this place is that it had some great shows but I would recommend this to families with kids 13 and under. Anyone older can go but the shows I feel are really meant for that age. They show the history of the Mayans and Aztecs but through acting, sports games and more like a show type of setting. A great place to spend the day if you are looking for something to do.

Visitamos los 4 parques de experiencias Xcaret aunque ya los conoc√≠amos, fue un regalo que le hicimos a nuestra hija por su buen desempe√±o escolar!

 si Bien fuimos con snorkel Admito que no vi peces. Me parece que el exceso de gente hace que no haya mucha vida marina.

Es un parque al que recomiendo a cualquier persona de cualquier edad! tiene detalles de dise√±o espectaculares Como por ejemplo en los ba√±os o cada Rinc√≥n d√≥nde dirijas tu mirada, realmente es un deleite para la vista! no s√≥lo para entretenerse!!
 adem√°s ahora tambi√©n tiene un espacio de juego para ni√±os tipo jungla que es hermoso y la playita aunque la achicaron para lucrar con las actividades especiales sigue siendo muy bonita! como para ir a descansar en una tumbona o hamaca paraguaya lo mismo en el agua con los gomones. o hacer el circuito de cuerdas para los m√°s atrevidos, nosotros quedamos exhaustos despu√©s de los nados por los r√≠os!

This is definitely one of the best parks I have ever been to!!!.  Yes it's expensive but if you want to experience the Mayan culture and get a better understanding of the history of Mexico, then this is the way to do it.  The park itself is huge and many people recommend at lest 2 days to see.  Considering it was a short stay on my end, I went for just 1 day but took advantage to see as much as I could in that 1 day.  And boy was there a lot to do.  From an awesome lazy river to Mayan shows to excursions and activities there's a lot to keep you busy.  If you are into nature you will definitely enjoy the beautiful landscape the park offers.  Here's a tip, at the end of the day there's a show at the theater which shows the history of Mexico which I highly recommend.  Be prepared for a long day but this is definitely a must do in Mexico.

Un paraiso en toda su extencion, necesitas muchois dias para recorrerlo. Buen lugar para ir solo, en familia o con amigos. Tienes diversidad de atracciones. Buenos restaurantes, vistas espectaculares, servicio rapido y amable. Una experiencia unica.

MY REVIEW OF:

XCARET

First with the good. You MUST go to Xcaret. I prefer this park to Disney because I feel it has substance and isn‚Äôt as cheesy as Disney. There are tons of fun things to do for ages up to about 12. After 12 they might want to do things a little more adventurous and go to Xplor Park. They also masterfully fuse nature with Mexican culture in a way that is super interesting and isn‚Äôt forced or gimmicky. 
I suggest a multi day pass. I made the mistake of thinking we could cover it all in a day. We might have been able to had we not added two excursions. 

Swimming with the sharks: I mean. Cool AF! Just sayin. Chelsea and I felt safe. We touched the sharks and swam with them as well. 

‚Äúworking‚Äù at 10 months because their gestational period is 12 months (NO THANK YOU!!)
A but pricey if you pay with Mex$ or credit card, but not bad if you pay in US$ (as they have a messed up conversion rate). Super fun for all ages and lots of activities to do!

We stayed next door at the Occidental Xcaret and had unlimited passes, thank goodness!  We covered all of it, I think, but there is just too much to see to do it all in one or two days.  We could walk back to our resort when we got tired and go back to Xcaret another time.  We are an older couple, 73 and 65, and the walking plus stairs were very tiring, but very worthwhile.  We loved the Espectacular night show, the sky tower, all the animal exhibits, the orchids, the horse show (but more seating is needed for the large crowds).  We didn't want to do any water activities there but still got to see the manatees, sharks, turtles, and big skates.  The river ride is good when you need to rest your feet and legs.  The grounds are beautifully kept, everything was amazingly clean, and the restrooms easy to find.  We loved the Mexican folk art, the Hacienda, and the archeological sites.  This was a wonderful place to visit.

Let me say this park it's expensive like Disneyland, but well worth it!!! The park its like a water park but at the natural!! The river and beach are awesome. The best part it's the last show!! I won't put a video or a picture because they won't expressed the beauty to it. The show its tree hours but you won't even notice it. Totally recommend to save money because i won't lie every thing inside its expensive.

Este parque es una maravilla, con actividades para adultos y ni√±os, mucha historia muy ordenado, seguro y sobretodo con un espect√°culo al final de la noche que permite conocer de manera extraordinaria la cultura mexicana, es una visita obligada para todos los q lleguen a Canc√∫n...

Xcaret has many sister properties in the Riviera Maya; Xoximilco Cancun, XelHa, Xichen etc.  All of these parks are outstanding for everyone but Xcaret is the biggest with many activities for the entire family.
excellent  love this place a little expensive but worh every cent especial night show.I have been here 2 times and still have not seen all of it?

We arrived at the facility and it was a lengthy process to get bracelets and get going in the park. We were told about the photos taken in the park that it is included in the plus package...IT WAS NOT FREE. One picture is $20 USD and all pictures of the day are $100 USD for a family of (4). So they encourage you not to bring your camera or phone, so you have to buy their DIGITAL PICTURES! If that's of interest to you, then budget for it! -The underground cave was filled with water, but you will have a life vest and guide ropes are along the wall in some areas of the cave. This whole park is great for the kids to see the dolphins, swim with them and take pictures with them. There are large parrots that you can take pictures with and hold them. There is a manatee with a baby that you can interact with in the water and feed her. 

There are several restaurants in the park that are decent ones for the family to eat and enjoy the time and food varieties.
 
The bus was crowded on the way back and a passenger refused to put the up her seat so I could sit behind her. She said she wanted to relax and sleep. This huge place is an excellent choice for the whole family. It put you in contact with nature in the safest way posible (so if you consider yourself a wanderer, maybe it will be too man-made for you).

This is an awesome park. Beats any Disney any day. AMAZING!! You can not come to Cancun and not go to Xcaret. Merece su fama, es un parque tem√°tico con opciones para toda la familia, nos lamentamos de haber pagado la entrada de un solo d√≠a.

Disfruta del parque, de los r√≠os, los espect√°culos, las actividades, el aviario, qued√≥ Impresionante no puedes dejar de visitarlo y disfrutarlo; adem√°s del espect√°culo M√©xico Espectacular.

El macdonalds de la Riviera Maya , quieres una experiencia artificial ? Visita xcaret , la mejor forma de desperdiciar un d√≠a de tus vacaciones , colas interminables , puro marketing , una verg√ºenza , no se lo recomiendo a nadie

O parque √© muito bem organizado e os funcion√°rios sempre sorridentes e atenciosos.
Meu pacote tinha almo√ßo e transfer para o hotel e recomendo, pois o √¥nibus foi pontual e a comida boa. Eu apenas n√£o lembro qual foi o restaurante, mas ele me foi recomendado pelo guia do √¥nibus, que disse que os outros n√£o eram t√£o bons.

We have visited both Xcaret and Xelha. Don‚Äôt think we‚Äôd return to Xcaret. Felt nickeled and dimed at every turn and would far prefer an all inclusive price like at Xelha. The Mexican Expectacular show was very good but the dinner price is ridiculous. If it had even been 50./each I would have considered it but 70.?!
Awesome Park, have been twice! I would even consider returning again in a few years.  Lots of walking, but worth it!

Overall is fun, but very expensive, considering one day is $130+, more than a disneyland ticket.  The river is fun, but very very cold.  Many of us got sick afterwards.  The river in the cave is very very dark sometimes, wish they install some lights in there, coz it could be a little scary for kids and when it is crowded and dark, it's just not nice.  The show at night is quite good, definitely worth to watch it considering the ticket price is so high.  The buffet is $30 per person, very expensive, so better buy the plus package.

Es un parque acuatico muy divertido con muchas tirolesas para hacer de gran altura y longitud. Alguna terminan en el agua. Hay muchos lockers para dejar la ropa y otros objetos. No lo recomiendo par chicos menores de 8 a√±os.

Incre√≠ble sitio para pasar un par de d√≠as. No hay que perderse los r√≠os subterr√°neos, el show nocturno, el nado con mantarrayas, el juego de pelota, el pueblo maya y los distintos espect√°culos folcl√≥ricos que se realizan.

I think this park is over-priced with rather rude staff (especially restaurants). The river swimming experience is unique (through underground caves). On the other hand I would highly recommend Xel-ha Theme Park which has far more and better attractions at a relatively lower price that also includes all you can eat and drink plus free towels (Xcaret, at least for my package, had one time buffet option no free towel or drinks-but rather than these free options I thought the attractions itself were much better).

I booked Xcaret through TUI at our local travel agent. It was over ¬£100 each for me and my partner. This included entry,  transport to and from the park and lunch. I knew that certain activities would be extra but I wasn‚Äôt prepared for just how much. I paid for my partner and myself to swim with the dolphins and to do the sea trek. In total this was an additional ¬£200! Then you had to pay for your photos with the dolphins separately which was another ¬£75! So be prepared...

Now that‚Äôs out of the way....

Xcaret is a great day out. There is so much to see and do, it‚Äôs difficult to fit it all into one day. 

The dolphin experience was amazing - a must do if you‚Äôve never done it before like me. My only advice would be if you have any valuables lock them up in the secure lockers at the entrance of the park. We left our belongings in the open cubby hole when we went to swim with the dolphins and our GoPro was taken. The security checked the cctv and said they couldn‚Äôt see anything but there was nowhere else it could‚Äôve gone. 

The underwater sea trek was a fantastic experience but not entirely as advertised. The picture shows bright corals and loads of fish and turtles etc but the reality was a bit more dingy. There were loads of fish and sting rays and once you get over the initial claustrophobia it‚Äôs very enjoyable. They even let you take your own pictures and videos. Which would‚Äôve been nice if our GoPro hadn‚Äôt been taken! Again there are no secure lockers here to leave your valuables so bear this is mind. 

The natural river was fun but extremely crowded. Be prepared to be clambered on and kicked! Is recommend doing this later on in the day rather than as soon as you enter the park like we did. It seemed to be quieter in the afternoon. 

The food was lovely - loads of different restaurants to choose from. We went to the  Caribbean hut. 

Xcaret is worth a visit and I probably would return but I‚Äôd book it whilst in Mexico as it seems cheaper.

It‚Äôs hard to even adequately describe Xcaret in comparable terms to other parks.  First of all, know that they place is a huge business and does everything first class.  It‚Äôs like the Disney of eco-parks.  4,000 employees, a totally high-end, immersive experience, etc.  And it‚Äôs such a mash-up of offerings compared to other experiences and parks we have done.  It‚Äôs like a blend of the Polynesian Culture Center from Hawaii (only massively larger in scale), a water park, a zoo and aquarium, a ruins site, nature trails, shopping village, unique cemetery, etc.  There really was no end to the range of things you could experience there, and this was just the main park of about 5 they run, most of which are directly adjacent to each other (except Xel-Ha which is 45 minutes further south in Tulum).

The signature feature of the park is their ‚ÄúUnderground river.‚Äù  You float along it in a provided life jacket for a couple miles.  Much of it is literally in caves.  Occasionally you break through to breathtaking sunlight or through dense forests of trees, etc. There are also many optional water activities ranging from swimming with dolphins, with sharks, with stingrays, snorkeling, SCUBA, Snuba, SeaTrek (you walk along the ocean floor with a large diving bell over your head to breath), speed boats, etc.  There are countless trails, animal and marine life exhibits.  There is a beautiful Mayan village, a church, and a cemetery unlike any I have seen before ‚Äî it‚Äôs a small hill circles with layers of colorful, decorate mini houses and other displays that each represents something about the life of the person buried there.  There are also ruins.

And it has the the most amazing and largest aviary I have ever experienced.  It took the better part of an hour to explore it and that‚Äôs without stopping to read anything.  There were at least 4 levels of trails and rivers and waterfalls, etc., all inside this aviary.

There were also a dozen restaurants, many of which were full buffets.

Sister parks include more specialized activities like zip lining and adventure courses, spa-like eco-trails, etc.

It‚Äôs a must-do if you are in the region.

We booked through Xcaret and they picked us up and dropped us off at our Cancun hotel in the hotel zone zone.  The bus was very comfortable and pick up and drop off was flawless.  We spent the whole day walking thru Xcaret and visiting the many attractions.  We brought our swim wear but there was so much to see and do that we never had time to do the water activities.  You really need 2 days to see the attractions and also do the water activities. The buffet lunch was included and we really liked the food.  They had 3 different restaurants you could choose from for the buffet.  We chose to view the attractions because we could always swim in Cancun.  The river float looked like fun, but just not enough time.  We did not do any of the added cost activities, again not enough time to see everything in one day.  There is a lot of walking, we are in our 60's but managed okay with taking rest breaks throughout the day.  There are different parts of the park and they are accessed via different colored paths.  We would follow one path to it's attractions and then take another, we used the map to minimize back tracking on the various paths.  There are even some Mayan ruins inside of the park. We also went up the revolving tower and as it was a clear day had great views of the area.  You can also use your wrist band to use the tower in Cancun for free (which we did the next day). The highlight of the day was the evening show that highlighted mexico's history, culture and regions.  While the show was in Spanish they did have some English translations on a large screen.  The costumes, music and singing were great and it was a very high energy show.  After the show, when leaving the park they were very organized for lining people up to take the right bus back to their hotels.  A long day but very entertaining and many insights into the Mexican culture.

This is an interesting place with an abundance of sea life, but everything was expensive, and it was very crowded.
There's a lot to see and do, but you better plan on getting there early, and being there all day.

This park is truly not to be missed. Even if you don't like getting wet there is plenty to do here. In fact, you can take a boat ride instead of swimming in the underground rivers (although I recommend doing the second one as there is nothing like it).

There is a small area with sand and palm trees on top of a short cliff where you exit from the underground rivers. Plenty of chairs and hammocks to lounge on with a beautiful view of the sea and several photo ops. You can walk down to the rocks and swim in a tiny lagoon.

We skipped the sea turtles since we going to swim with them at another excursion. The butterfly exhibit was definitely worth visiting, and you can get a nice picture on a rock with falls behind you at the bird sanctuary. The best part of the bird sanctuary is the hike to the top. Just amazing.

Jaguar island was hardly worth it. We eventually did see one jaguar laying down but it was pretty far to see clearly.

The replica of the Mayan cemetery was beautiful. It was also enjoyable walking through the ancient replica structures. We didn't spend much time at the real ruins since there wasn't nearly as much to see as Tulum. 

The kids world is perfect for children 13 and younger. There are lagoons, trails, obstacle courses and water slides. Our 8 year old daughter spent about two hours there and didn't want to leave.

The show at the end is a must-see. Definitely stay till the end. It really felt like a major broadway production and you don't pay anything extra to watch it. Our daughter was tired by the end of the day but stayed awake to watch the entire thing as she was totally enthralled. 

Tips

* If you purchased a ticket that includes a meal, wait until dinner and eat at La Cocina. They have a horse show at 6:00pm and you will have a great view of the action from the restaurant. Otherwise the bleacher seats fill up fast and early (people began sitting there as early as 5:00pm).

* People start finding seats at the theater as early as 5:45pm for the night show but there really aren't any bad seats so don't worry about getting there super early. That being said if you want a seat right near the action you probably want to get there by 6:15pm. Don't try reserving for your entire party if they aren't with you- they won't let you.

* Swim the underground river first and then work your way from the back of the park to the front. Yes everyone else does it that way but it really is the best way to see the park and it is not like Disney World where you are waiting in long lines to experience things.

Es un lugar que no hay que dejar de visitar si venis a playa del carmen o cancun. Spent 8 hours here, show was amazing, grounds beautiful some.very good history, turtle conservation. 3 mo before we come down turtles hatched down in plya. They brought the turtles here. Very good day.. for STAFF. Jacopo. IIaman .jorge .tomas. liliana rosita .Wonderful people who make you feel really good warm thanks to you soon. I recomme it to everyone..

Full disclosure we did get a discount of $200.00 by going to time share presentation. But even At full price worth the visit. Get there early, so much to see & do the dolphin  swim if they offer 50% discount which did for us . $250.00 for 5 of us but great experience. Zoo really cool, river swim ok but better on hot day since water a bit cold. After 8 years of basically spending lazy days at our royal hacienda resort decided our 3 boys 7,9& 10 were old enough for one of the theme parks , bit of a splurge but no regrets, we had great time . Passamos um dia excelente por l√°. Parque estava cheio, e fazia frio. Rio subterr√¢neo foi uma experi√™ncia √≥tima, mas o frio da √°gua pegou para as crian√ßas menores. Mi hijos de 4 a√±os los disfruto tanto Como nosotros, hermoso lugar, limpio. Organizado, Los shows hermosos.
No se puede pedir nada mass.

We come here every time we come to Mexico and never get bored its a great family day out with lots to, the evening show is great but for smaller children they would probably find its goes on a bit long and fall asleep as they would have been worn out from the day of fun they have had at Xcaret.

If you're looking for a Disney type theme park, this is not for you. There will be a lot of walking. The grounds are beautiful. There are many wonderful eco attractions. Their sea turtle program is great. They keep the sea turtles for a year then release them into the sea. They have a snorkeling area included in the admission price. There are other attractions for additional costs. We made five visits to the park during our weeks vacation. The park is educational and fun. Their nightly drama is spectacular. I definitely recommend this park.

Ta p√• dig bekv√§ma skor f√∂r du kommer g√• mycket! Otroligt mycket att se, allt fr√•n en fj√§rilstr√§dg√•rd till akvarium till delfiner... k√∂per du xcaret plus f√•r du simma in i parken genom en undervattensflod, vilket var supermysigt!

We visited the Xcaret Eco Theme Park several times as it was attached to our hotel during our stay in Mexico, which was perfect.

There is so much to do and see, turtles, parrots, snorkeling, wild animals and history.

It's a great way to spend the day, especially if the weather isn't the best for the beach.

This park is seriously amazing! 
My husband and I enjoyed watching the flying men, checking out the ruins, looking at all the fun creatures and making amazing memories. 
I just wish we had an additional day or two to explore more of the park. It's huge and wonderful with lots of fun gift shops and things to do with your kids. They even have a pink flamingo parade. This place is definitely worth checking out for sure!

El lugar es incre√≠ble!!! Realizamos snorkel en un arrecife toda la familia fue algo que no vamos a olvidar hermoso

We booked our 1-day Xcaret Plus pass directly from their website over a month in advance, which got us discounted price.  (Reminder to bring your photo ID and credit card you used to purchase the ticket for entry)

We stayed at Occidental Resort, which is walking distance from Xcaret park. They have a cute little boat that takes you from the resort to the park, which we used.  

Recommendations: Mayan floating river, aviary area, sea turtles and manatees, beach area, scenic tower, and night show.

Food: Highly recommend the international buffet that's along the black path. So good! We originally planned on going to the int'l buffet near the blue path, but found it to be unexpectedly closed.

Floating River: Get the Xcaret Plus and do the Mayan River instead of Manatee River. This is what we did after reading many reviews, and found it to be efficient - Put all your belongings in the bag that gets transported to the end of the river. If you use the lockers, then you can't use anything in your locker until you come back all the way to the entrance of the park.  In our bag we put changing clothes, towels, hairbrush, camera, water bottle, tennis shoes, etc. The Mayan River takes you to the very end of the park near the beachside and it's about an hour float.  We kept our waterproof phone pouch and phone with us. We wore our own water shoes instead of the huge fins. After putting your belongings in the bag, get your life jacket and then you're on your way! 

Special Passes: We got there at 9:30AM and planned our path well to ensure we saw everything in one day, so we only got 1-day pass. We got Xcaret Plus, which included life jacket and lunch. If you have children or are doing any special activities that require additional pay (swimming with dolphins, sharks, etc) then you might need another day and a 2-day pass might be worth it.  

Optimal path - After floating river, we were right next to the beach side so we walked through that to enjoy the scenic view and take photos. Then we headed back down toward the entrance area following the black path and went through the butteryfly and aviary area and got lucky to see a leopard. We saw everything in the black path. Then we went through the green path hoping to eat lunch at the int'l buffet that's along the green path, but that was closed, so we went back to the int'l buffet along the black path. Afterwards we headed towards the top of the blue path and walked along down the blue path to see everything there and made it towards the entrance.  We followed the brown path out the park but went up the scenic tower first before heading to our resort next door.  We got in the park 9:30 and saw everything by 3:30 and chilled at our resort. We sat down at the night show theatre 30 minutes early (6:30) to ensure we got close seating. We sat 4 rows up.

Night Show: Highlight of the entire park. AMAZING no words.

Clothing: We went into the park wearing our swimsuits.  I had a swim dress on that looks like a summer dress.  That way we didn't waste time changing clothes since we did the floating river first.  Then we went to the dressing room and changed into dry clothes.  I wore a summer dress with tennis shoes since there's a lot of walking involved.

Las instalaciones son muy grandes, bellas, limpias, con infinidad de actividades, folklor, naturaleza, playa, snorkel, en fin... De verdad que vale mucho la pena, la experiencia es inolvidable!
Lo m√°s recomendable es hospedarse en el hotel Occidental Xcaret y comprar entrada ilimitada al parque durante su estancia para que puedan disfrutar de todo lo que ofrece el pareque tranquilamente.

Es la segunda ves que visit√≥ el parque Xcaret y me sigue encantando al igual que a toda mi familia. Es una experiencia muy bonita y adem√°s es un lugar s√∫per cuidado y limpio. Vale la pena visitarlo.

It was just ten minutes from playa del carmen, very well organized, the came to my hotel and explain everything about our visit, 
The swim in the xenotes is very safe and amazing, my kids loved it, it was almost an our.there are many activities and show.
The bird area was amazing and when we were tired to walk around we went inthe kids area with water slides to chill.
After all a very nice day with family

We spent an entire day at Xcaret. We were the first one to get in by 8:45 and we were the first ones in the underground rivers by 9:00. It took us almost an hour but what an expeirence!! Highly recommended. They took our bags locked and transported it for free to the end point where we collected them (they gave us the keys). This place is out of the  world. The Aviary and butterfly park are very nice too. Overall very nicely spread. Multiple restaurants with decent international buffet. There was no real beach here with waves.. the beach was rocky. Snorkeling was just 'meh'.. we have seen so many better places around the globe. Childrens park is good with a lot of obstacle courses, water slides etc.  Overall, a good place to visit with the family

Aunque las entradas al parque pueden ser algo costosas, el plan que dura todo 1 dia en el plan de almuerzo incluido, vale la pena definitivamente. El contacto con la naturaleza, las playas, los cenotes, paseo en balsa en medio de un ambiente tan tranquilo definitivamente vale la pena. 
La comida en los restaurantes nos parecio muy buena con diferentes opciones y ubicados en varios lugares del parque.
El show final es un gran esfuerzo por hacer un evento de gran altura, te ayuda a conocer la historia de Mexico, sus costumbres y entender mas de su cultura. 
En general es una gran experiencia visitar Xcaret quedamos muy felices con esta experiencia y la recomendamos sin dudarlo.
O parque faz-nos sentir como se tiv√©ssemos realmente numa ilha tropical, a comida √© boa e √© muito organizado as filas para as actividades demoram muito pouco tempo
El parque es enorme y muy bello hay actividades para todos los gustos y edades, nadar por los r√≠os es genial y el espect√°culo de M√©xico m√°gico es maravilloso!!!

Everything was truly well designed, fun, educational and the park closed with a show that was incredibly delightful to watch and listen to. We loved every minute of our adventure in this theme park. Worth every pesos without question.

From the pick up from our resort to this theme park, all was excellent. If you don't like crowds choose wisely. All the themes are mapped out for you. We did 8 hours there which included floating in the water for almost an hour and half. Lunch buffets are excellent and lots of food to choose from. 
Uneven grounds so wear good sandals and shoes. Bring water shoes if you want. Swimming in the caves was a great experience! There is so much to do it will keep you entertained all day. Long walks so if you have children be prepared. Can be very hot and humid, bring sunscreen and water to drink or you can buy it. A great day and lots of photo opportunities. Enjoy!

We bought the Plus pass for a day at the park. With that pass a life jacket, locker and fins were provided. A meal was included as well. The Cenote swim was a whole lot of fun!  They provide locking duffel bags for your things and valuables. The bags are transported to the other end and are ready for you when you exit the water. My husband and girls swam the Cenote‚Äôs more than once. Due to cooler temperatures, I opted see other features of the park instead. We ate our meal at the International buffet along the black route. It was incredibly busy, long lines and they could not keep up with the demand for food. What we did eat was poor in quality and taste. Not worth the money. The horse show was good, however their viewing area is not even remotely close to big enough for the amount of people trying to see the performance. People were saving seats 1 1/2 - 2 hours before the show. It was standing room only and hopefully you don‚Äôt have anyone taller than you in front. The evening performance was very well done and showcases the history of the Mexican culture. It‚Äôs a huge facility with plenty of seating and there is no bad place to sit. It was great to go to Xcaret once. I probably would not choose to go again.

Xcaret es uno de Los parques tem√°ticos m√°s divertidos de la ribera maya . Se pueden hacer todo tipo de activodades acu√°ticas y hace unos a√±os agregaron una especie de zool√≥gico con animales como leones , tigres , etc . Tiene una playa muy linda y es un lugar muy agradable para ir con familia , amigos o en pareja . Los shows son muy lindos . S√∫per recomendable.

We managed to do everything we wanted in 1 day. We skipped any extra cost activities, skipped lounging on their beautiful lagoons. We had a great time wandering around the trails, having a look and all the cool things. Stopped for the buffet at la laguna, could have skipped that. Maybe the actual restaurants are better? We ended our day with the cave swim. Fun!

There is no doubt that Ixcaret is a spectacular place, but a few days ago trying to buy tickets for the park left me quite unhappy.
I gave the tickets to my niece and her boyfriend who were on vacation in the Riviera Maya (like when you buy plane tickets online for a family member or third party, they send you an email with the boarding pass and the person only presents an identification to make it valid, or thousands of similar cases such as concerts, museums, etc.). At the Ixcaret site, they are clear when emphasizing that the ticket must be printed before going to the park and in the purchase process, in addition to my personal information, they ask who will claim / use the tickets. Arrived  the time of their trip, when my niece went to print the tickets, she found that in addition to the ticket to access the park, they had to take a copy of my credit card, and my personal identification on both sides to see how I sign (I do not understand why, being an online purchase). When my niece calls me and tells me this, I immediately contact the customer service of the park, where they confirm the above and that in case my identification does not have a visible signature, I must also send a copy of my passport.
 The best part is when I ask what happens with the copy of ALL MY PERSONAL DOCUMENTS and they respond that they keep those copies. Remember, that in the online site they already have my address, telephone and others, so at this point only They are just missing to ask for my Social Security number (I live in the USA). Never in any internet site I had been requested something so ridiculous buying online either for me, or buying as in this case, for third parties when I'm not with them. Definitely be very careful when you go to buy tickets to Ixcaret for family or friends and you are not present on the trip to save yourself a bad time. Kudos for Anahi in customer service who behaved very professionally despite my visible discontent

Requerimiento adsurdo en la compra de tickets online

No hay duda de que Ixcaret es un lugar espectacular, pero hace unos dias tratando de comprar unas entradas para el parque me dejo bastante descontento.
Le regale las entradas a mi sobrina y su novio que  andaban de vacaciones por la Riviera Maya (como cuando uno compra tiquetes de avion para un familiar o tercero online; te mandan un correo electronico con el pase de abordar y la persona solamente presenta una identificacion para hacerlo valido, o miles de casos similares como conciertos, museos, etc). En el sitio de Ixcaret, son claros al enfatizar que se debe imprimir el boleto de entrada antes de ir al parque y en el proceso de compra, ademas de mi informacion personal, preguntan quien va reclamar/usar los tiquetes. LLegado el momento de su viaje, fueron a imprimir los boletos, pero se encontraron con que ademas de eso les exigian para poder acceder al parque, que tenian que llevar copia de mi tarjeta de credito, y mi identificacion personal por ambos lados para ver como firmo (no entiendo porque al ser una compra online). Cuando mi sobrina me llama y me cuenta esto, yo inmediatamente me comunico con servicio al cliente del parque, donde me confirman lo anterior y que en caso tal de que mi identificacion no tenga firma visible, debo enviar ademas copia de mi pasaporte.
 La mejor parte es cuando pregunte que pasa con la copia de TODOS MIS DOCUMENTOS PERSONALES y me responden que ellos se quedan con esas copias, Vale recordar, que en el sitio online ya tienen mi direccion, telefono y demas, asi que a este punto solo les falta pedirme el numero de mi Seguro social (vivo en USA). Nunca en ningun sitio de internet me habian hecho una solicitud tan adsurda comprando en linea ya fuera para mi o comprando como en este caso, para terceros cuando yo no estoy con ellos. Definitivamente tengan mucho cuidado cuando vayan a comprar entradas a Ixcaret para familiares o amigos y ustedes no estan presentes en el viaje para que se ahorren un mal rato. Kudos para Anahi en servicio al cliente que se porto muy profesionalmente a pesar de mi visible descontento.

We had a wonderful time, but struggled to endure cold weather. We missed some of the water attractions because it was to cold. I strongly recommend visiting in Summer Months.
The park is very clean and personnel very helpful, the buffet food is just ok.
The cons:
-The park is expensive by itself, and once inside you have to pay excessive amounts for each of the best activities available. 
-Also drinks, candies and chips are extremely expensive.

Recomiendo llevar poco equipaje y llevarlo encima,ya que en los lockers queda muy inc√≥modo volver a buscar los dadas las grandes distancias a recorrer. Muy lindo los voladores de papantla y M√©xico espectacular. La cena en este ultimo ofrece la oportunidad de degustar varios platos t√≠picos de la cocina mexicana

√â uma parte muito bonita onde voc√™ pode se relacionar com a natureza, o M√©xico √© t√£o lindo que eu quero ficar aqui. Eu gostei bastante dos rios e da praia, mas o mais espetacular √© o show noturno.

Debo decir que es el mejor parque que he visitado. Hay un sinf√≠n de cosas por ver, nos encant√≥ estar en contacto con la naturaleza. Tuvimos la oportunidad de tomar excelentes fotograf√≠as. La mejor parte es que no hay mosquitos, lo cual me sorprendi√≥ bastante ya que me esperaba miles de ellos, afortunadamente nuestro paseo estuvo muy bien. La caleta es hermosa, llegas a pensar que es una piscina por la tranquilidad del agua, todo est√° muy limpio, la comida est√° rica y todos te atienden con una sonrisa, Alfred de la cocina Mexicana fue muy atento con nosotros. 

Lo MEJOR de todo el d√≠a fue el SHOW en la noche, es IMPRESIONANTE! Un show de primer mundo, te hace sentir orgulloso de ser mexicano. Visitar√≠a otra vez el parque principalmente por el show.

we purchased this excursion through Viator prior to arriving in Cancun.  We did the plus tor since it included lunch and there were 9 of us in attendance.  We were picked up promptly at our hotel in a comfortable mini bus and taken to Xcaret without incident.  Fun info and facts were given along the way so we knew what to expect.  We were also shown and told where to meet at the time we needed to depart.  We arrived, bypassed the "add ons" and went directly to the caves for swimming...wow, what a beautiful feature. It's a long swim but certainly something everyone should experience if at all possible.  At the end of the caves our belongings were given to us in the waterproof bag, we unlocked twitch the key they assigned us and we changed and went to go find a place to enjoy lunch.  We had a buffet lunch of shredded tacos and other regional items and spent a relaxing time with exceptional service. After lunch we strolled a short distance and gathered some chairs along the beach and enjoyed the spectacular views for about 2 hours, a few of our group went snorkeling, some found a hammock and napped.  Perfect afternoon. We then took our time walking back and shopped some and took the mini bus back to our hotel... PERFECT DAY!

El parque es muy bonito tiene de todo para todos los gustos, muy grande tanto que no se puede recorrer completo en un s√≥lo d√≠a pero vale la pena intentarlo lo √∫nico que no me gust√≥ es que las toallas te las rentan muy caras, y las fotos de las actividades extra est√°n muy caras tambi√©n de ah√≠ en mas todo excelente y no se diga el espect√°culo nocturno es lo mejor que he visto en M√©xico.

Es un lugar m√°gico para pasar todo el d√≠a, abren desde la 8:30 de la ma√±ana y  es recomendable llegar temprano para hacer la mayor cantidad de actividades posible. 
Han logrado hacer de este parque un lugar que todas las personas del mundo deber√≠an de conocer debido a lo limpio y el hermoso estado en el que lo conservan.
La comida es de primera calidad y la atenci√≥n de todos los empleados es de primer mundo.
Por la tarde tienes que prepararte para llegar antes de las 18:30 al show que inicia a las 19:00 horas,ya que si el parque esta muy lleno te puedes quedar fuera, debido a que el cupo es limitado.

So glad that we went to this amazing class it was included in our ticket to Xcaret, it's Great experience if you don't enjoy water.   Our instructor was Jesus he was amazing kind and a good teacher he knew many things about chocolate and he is also Native of the area. We did not plan to get into the water due to the weather not being very warm so we looked for many activities for our family to enjoy without getting wet.

I had read a lot about this place and wanted to check it out. On my previous Cancun vacation I went to Xel-ha and loved it.  This place is SO beautiful! Floating the river from one end of the park to the other alone was worth the money.  The snorkeling was neat, but pretty crowded which I expected.  Because we went around Christmas they had an afternoon parade with a band.  They walked around the park and sang Christmas carols.  It was really neat to see! But wait...if you go you NEED to stay for the show they have at night.  Hands down the coolest thing there....minus the river. :) It was really neat to learn more about Mayan culture....oh and the dancing and singing. Vegas style for sure.  You won't regret it!

To quote the late great football announcer Keith Jackson, in terms of eco-adventure parks in the Mayan Riviera, Xcaret is the ‚Äúgranddaddy of ‚Äòem all‚Äù.  In our latest trip with our friends we were looking at excursions, and having done Xel-Ha, a sister property to Xcaret, a couple of years ago, we wanted to try something different.  Xcaret actually describes itself as an eco-archaeological park as opposed to eco-adventure, but there is definitely both aspects to it as there are both land and water activities at the park, which is just south of Playa del Carmen.  The big draw of Xcaret is the fact it is a park that celebrates the history and culture of Mexico and is capped off by a nightly spectacular show, which according to the tour guides is ranked one of the best in the world (how do you not believe a Mexican tour guide)?  All kidding aside I have heard it is a pretty magnificent show ‚Äì yes, heard, not seen, and I‚Äôll tell you why down below.

In terms of booking tickets, you can head to website of Xcaret, where they offer a number of different levels of tickets.  The base ticket offers entry into the park and that‚Äôs about it ‚Äì no lockers, food, or snorkelling gear.  The Xcaret Plus gives you the base entry plus the aforementioned food at one of their many restaurants (only 1 meal though and 1 adult beverage), locker rental and free use of the snorkelling gear.  Xcaret Total gives you Xcaret Plus and 1 activity that is normally over and above the regular price (such as Sea Trek or Snuba).  Should you book online at least 7 days ahead of time they will give you 10% off ‚Äì 21 days ahead is 15% off but you do have to pick the exact date you‚Äôd like to go.  They say you can make changes to that date, but not the day of the event ‚Äì meaning once you get to Mexico check out the forecast ‚Äì if the weather day of your event doesn‚Äôt look so good change your date right away ‚Äì they will not let you change the day of the event.  Kids under 11 are 50% off.

We got an email around Black Friday that said they had a sale on, giving us the Xcaret Plus ticket including transportation (I‚Äôll tell you why you don‚Äôt want to book it later) for a reduced price ‚Äì once all was said and done we bought 3 adult tickets and 1 child ticket for about $500 CAD, which according to current website prices saved us about $140 off their internet rates.

Because we were able to get transportation included, we were picked up by a nice bus in front of our hotel at 7:45am ‚Äì pretty early for a vacation but it was a big, and even though discounted, a fairly expensive day.  The bus only stopped at one other hotel, which ended up being another Iberostar in our complex and away we went ‚Äì overall it was about a 35-40 minute drive south to Xcaret.  During our trip the tour guide told us all about Xcaret and made some recommendations as to how to navigate the park as efficiently as possible.  In terms of getting the most out of our day, he recommended that we start with the underground rivers and then the snorkelling in the morning and the land activities later ‚Äì however seeing as we got there around 9am and it was maybe 17-18 degrees Celsius with the water temp right around there, that wasn‚Äôt gonna happen.  He is right as those areas were very quiet in the morning but it was pretty obvious as to the reason behind that.

Instead we did what normal people would do ‚Äì we checked the map and made a plan and waited for it to warm up.  The map and the park were laid out very well and different areas are color coded via the paths you take to get there and around the areas.  For example, the zoo/aquarium area was blue coded so as long as you followed the blue path you were in the right place.  And that‚Äôs where we started as it was closest to the lockers and the start of the underground rivers for later ‚Äì it was a nice start as they had some domestic creatures like the fat Tapir and some nurse sharks in a tank ‚Äì but the stars of this show are all the turtles they had on display.  Everything from babies to fully grown sea turtles are around and there is something about those lazy looking things that make me happy.

By nearly 11 it definitely had warmed up so we hustled over and changed into swim suits for the underground rivers ‚Äì lifejackets and flippers are the main gear for this one ‚Äì no tubes as the water does not move you ‚Äì only you and your flippers.  There are 3 rivers to choose from but they all end up in the same spot and probably have similar cool caves and openings to swim through.  All in all it was a very cool swim ‚Äì cool scenery and cool water ‚Äì but well worth the journey.  The kids (ages 9-12) had no issues other than the odd flipper shot from another swimmer in the ribs, and it is about 1 km once all is said and done.  The one surprising fact about the river experience is that from the time we decided to go back to the lockers, change, get our gear, do the river and then dry off was about 1 hr 45 minutes‚Ä¶it was not a short part of the day.

A couple of recommendations for the underground river ‚Äì before you get your lifejacket and other gear you get to throw some essentials (towels, sandals and more) into a bag that gets locked up and taken to the end of the river so you can dry off ‚Äì also take some clothes to put on (t-shirt or cover-up) because you are 1km away now from the lockers and it‚Äôs a bit of a jaunt back, which takes up a lot of your day and after being in that river you will be sporting a couple of diamondcutters on your chest.  Also if you do not have an underwater camera they do sell the iphone waterproof covers, but for about $59US ‚Äì our resort sold them for $39US so you can easily find one for a lot cheaper than what they have on site.

As you may have noticed I haven‚Äôt said why 1) not to take their transportation yet or 2) why we didn‚Äôt see the spectacular show‚Ä¶it‚Äôs coming‚Ä¶

We finished the river and went for lunch at one of their many restaurants and enjoyed pretty much exactly what we would have at the resorts, except less free beer.  At this point some of the group are done with water activities while the rest want to snorkel ‚Äì so we walk by the jaguar and puma (yes singular each and busy sleeping) and then head to the lockers (remember that 1 km journey?) where some people change and then we head over to one of the snorkelling areas, and we see why the tour guide told us to get there early.  The place is jam packed!  I‚Äôm not even sure any fish could fit in between all the fins in the water!  Nonetheless, 8 or 9 of us out of 12 grab the snorkel gear that is included and head into the cove ‚Äì yes there are some fish but the area is truly overloaded with waaaay too many people.  Overall the snorkelling is short-lived but after the rivers, lunch, and walking back and forth from the lockers it is after 3pm.  By this point everyone is done with water activities so another jaunt back to the lockers for the final dry off and change into dry clothes, but we are now close to 3:30pm.

Now‚Äôs here why I suggest not taking their transportation and finding your own way to Xcaret ‚Äì when we left our hotel at 7:45am we were told there were 2 options of getting home again on their transportation ‚Äì either before the show, which we were told we had to meet by 4:30pm, or after the show, which left at 9:30pm, and if you stayed for the show you also had to book dinner at one of the ‚Äúshow‚Äù restaurants, which isn‚Äôt included in any of their packages.

So as you can see by my timeline above, either we have 1 hr left in the park or 6 hrs left ‚Äì at that point we all agreed that the underground rivers knocked the snot out of us so we only had 1 hr left, but a lot of park to still see.  The kids wanted to go to the scenic tower, which is near the entrance and takes you up about 80m and revolves, giving everyone a great panoramic view of the area.  It is about a 10 min experience.

Once we were finished with that it was 4:20pm and basically time to go ‚Äì we didn‚Äôt get much time near the water nor in the Mexican cultural area ‚Äì had we taken a taxi (and we have done this before and easily found a decent deal for all 12 of us) we could have left around 6 and seen everything the park has to offer, except for the show.  And although it would have been to see the ‚Äúespectacular!‚Äù I certainly was in agreement that another 5 hrs at the park was going to be a waste with pretty much a guarantee that 3-4 kids were going to fall asleep during the show.  By the time we got back to the resort it was a 10 hour day which was more than enough for a Mexican Excursion.

Did we like it?  Yes ‚Äì it was a very cool place and I wish we had a little more time to finish it.

It would take too many words to describe what you can do at this park so I'm going to make it easy for you with some tips for your trip to Xcaret.

They have lots of buffet style restos around the park with a few bars scattered around as well.

You're going to have a great time here.  Just be prepared physically and mentally to be there all day.

We were looking for a botanical garden type of place to visit and Xcaret was the closest we could find.  They have many different water features one can take part in, however we really just wanted to walk and see the plants, butterflys and birds.  And walk we did, however it was good exercise and I'm not complaining.  This park is owned by Mexicans and they are very proud of it.  The park is set up really well and it is easy to get around in it because they have it sectioned off by colors.  Whichever color of the park you are in is marked on the walkway so you always know where you are in the park.  Personally I loved the birds.  So many and so beautiful.  There are many places you can have lunch at there.  We decided on the Mexican buffet and we definitely made the right decision.  It was a buffet that had more items than we could possibly eat.  We did not stay around later in the afternoon for the shows, however I hear that they are really spectacular.  That will be for our next trip there.  The only thing I'll recommend is that you should be prepared for walking and for humidity, as it is like a rain forest really.  We are from Arizona so the extreme humidity was a challenge for us.  Overall though it was fine and I would certainly recommend this as a top place to visit.  A very fun outing.

Float in three crystal clear underground rivers, visit a Mayan village, see Jaguars and Pumas, a gorgeous Mexican hacienda, a Mexican rodeo, aquariums, archaeological sites and so much more. The day ends with a spectacular show on the history and culture of Mexico. Spend the extra money for the dinner offered during the show. It was unbelievable. Words don't do justice to this #1 park in the world.

My family of 15 (ages 70-7) had a great time at this park. The water temperature for the underground rivers was a little chilly but, since it is not a "lazy river floating" experience, everyone warmed up. The three river courses are quite different (although the staff may tell you they are all the same), our family felt that it was definitely worth trying all three.
The grounds have a wide variety of exhibits, from a butterfly house and aviary to a nature walk and historic hacienda. As the day wore on we found the crowds a little off putting but, if you are staying nearby you can leave and come back. The parking is well organized but at least during our visit giving up a good parking space was enough motivation to stay put. 
The specialty shows like the horse riding demonstration or chocolate making "class" were fun and of course the Mayan influence was nice to experience.
This is a pricey attraction but our family enjoyed it.

Muy lindo el parque y bien cuidado. Tiene lockers para guardar las pertenencias. Hay variedad de restaurantes y buffets para almorzar. El unico detalle es que deben pagarse muchas actividades extra ya que la pulsera aunque sea vip no incluye las m√°s lindas de realizar

I came here with 3 other families; 3 of which had children under 4 years old. We walked around like you would at a zoo. There were small buildings that were aquariums. Then as we left one there were hundreds of turtles and it was quite a sight to see! After, we continued and saw the flamingo crossing. The whole family loved this. Flamingoes who were trained (like a dog would be). It was adorable and like nothing we‚Äôve seen before. Then we swam through a river holding our 1 and 3 year old (they provided life jackets for all of us and free bags for us to lock our belongings in and drove them to the end for us to get at the end of our trip). It was great! The water felt wonderful and the sights along the way, including caves with bats that we went through, were fantastic. The best part is that there are stops throughout the park and along the river for you to scan your wristband and have photos taken and attached to your band. We were able to attach all 4 bands (from our 4 families) and buy a package of the photos - it was one price and we had nearly 100 photos! I only wish there were places in the US that did that. We ate at one of the restaurants afterward and it was fantastic too! We would do it again - all of us! We only spent about 7 hours there but we didn‚Äôt even get to see everything. It was worth it to us, we loved it!
We were pleasantly surprised by what a fun day we had here. We saw lots of animals and the highlight was definitely snorkeling the underground river.
If you can only visit one park at Playa Del Carmen, this is the one. It has everything you can do, underground river swimming, snorkeling, night shows.

     Went back in 2 days as we thought the place would be neat to see in the daytime. We were not disappointed. This park is the perfect combination of activity, wildlife spotting, cultural and historical entertainment. It's a hybrid between Jurassic Park and Indiana Jones. And lots and lots of swimming. Runs like clockwork and is super organised. They are really serious about their conservation efforts.

We took a Royal Caribbean excursion to Xcaret and enjoyed it immensely. Be sure to bring water shoes that you can use to walk to the lazy river and swim 35 minutes with a jacket life preserver. Otherwise, you will need to walk barefoot from the locker to the river. Do not plan to swim the lazy river if you are claustrophobic. There are long distances through a narrow tunnel that is not that well lit. Everyone has to pack their belongings into a large duffel bag and is given a key to the lock. Be sure to secure the key to your life preserver jacket very well. We lost the key in the river and had to pay $6 to have the lock cut on the duffel bag. I probably would have paid more because I was dripping wet, shivering, and badly needed the towel in the duffel bag. We enjoyed seeing the wonderful animals, aquarium, hacienda, butterfly garden, and model pyramids. A great day!

Xcaret es un eco parque muy grande. Dif√≠cilmente un visitante pueda recorrerlo todo en una s√≥la visita. Las asistentes que se encuentran en la entrada del mismo nos asesoraron sobr√© c√≥mo ser√≠a mejor recorrerlo para no perderse de lo m√°s importante. El mariposario es imperdible y el aviario tambi√©n. Todos los shows est√°n cuidados en detalles. Los animales como las tortugas, tiburones, manta rayas tambi√©n est√°n muy cuidadas. Recomiend subir la torre esc√©nica desde donde se puede observar toda la costa y la gran selva que rodea este gran emprendimiento. El piso est√° se√±alizado con l√≠neas de colores para poder seguirlas en los mapas que te entregan al ingresar. Seguimos la l√≠nea azul, la blanca, y la negra. As√≠ pudimos ver casi todo lo del parque. Finalizamos el recorrido de los r√≠os subterr√°neos y nuestras pertenencias que hab√≠amos dejado al ingresar en un bolso que se cierra delante tuyo, ya estaba en el sector de salida. Pudimos secarnos y dirigirnos al Restaurant que desearamos . Elegimos El Manglar. Abundant√≠simo todo lo que comimos y muy sabrosa toda la comida. Entradas, platos principales de todos los gustos y postres tambi√©n. Bebida sin alcohol ilimitada y una cerveza por persona adulta. Posteriormente seguimos la l√≠nea negra y llegamos al delfinario, observamos a quienes realizaban la actividad (que no tiene interacci√≥n con el delf√≠n) y luego vimos tortugas y tiburones. El show de los caballos previo al show final de Xcaret M√©xico espectacular, lo evitar√≠a. Mucha gente esper√≥ largo rato para ver escasa destreza. Es imperdible el ultimo show que finaliza a las 21hs. Tiene un intermedio de 10 minutos donde se explica que los colectivos o transportes esperar√°n a toda la gente y que no es necesario perderse el final del show. Tal cual, nosotros llegamos en vans p√∫blicas (45 pesos mexicanos) y tomamos "el despeinado o el p√≠caro" (los transportes de xcaret para recorrer el tramo desde la ruta hasta la puerta del lugar) y sin ning√∫n problema regresamos idem . En la ruta,ya de noche. esperaban varias vans para recoger a la gente. Muy seguro todo. Sin problemas.

Estuvimos en el parque junto a mi mujer y nuestro hijo de 3 a√±os. La pasamos muy buen en todo momento. Llegamos a las 10:30 aprox y nos fuimos al finalizar el show principal a las 21:00 hs. Hicimos el nado por el r√≠o secreto, con salvavidas todos, aunque nos dimos cuenta despu√©s que no hab√≠amos pedido las patas de rana (infaltables para cansarse menos). En todo momento uno est√° seguro (yo no s√© nadar, en algunos lugares hab√≠a profundidad superior a los 2mts. Y no tuve ning√∫n problema ni temor). En cuanto a animales, lo m√°s lindo, los delfines y las tortugas gigantes. El acuario tambi√©n es lindo para los chicos sobre todo. Entre un circuito y otro se puede tomar un ba√±o en el sector de Playa artificial. Hay otras opciones para hacer que nosotros no hicimos por la edad de nuestro hijo pero que hubiese hecho, como la caminata por el lecho marino, con unos cascos enormes que tienen ox√≠geno para que uno pueda caminar por ah√≠ abajo como si estuviese en la superficie.
